Combine in a large bowl and mash together. If the bananas started out a little green, cover the bowl and let it sit for a half hour.

Combine in the bowl of a stand mixer with the paddle attachment. Mix on low until the coconut oil is no longer visible in the batter. Add the banana mixture and mix just until the batter no longer has any visible dry flour.

Fold into mixture with a rubber spatula. Spoon about a half cup of batter into each of 12 spaces in a muffin tin. Bake for 25 minutes or until the batter has risen into a muffin-esque topology and lightly browned. Cool and serve.
Combine in the bowl of a food processor and pulse to combine until the coconut oil is no longer visible and the mixture appears dry. Transfer to a medium bowl.
Toss with the flour mixture until incorporated.
Stir in with a rubber spatula to form a soft dough.

Lightly flour the parchment paper and place the dough on it. Pat the dough into a 7-inch round and refrigerate it for 15 minutes. Preheat your oven to 400 F with a rack in the lower-middle position. Cut the dough into 6 equal pieces and arrange them on parchment on a half sheet pan.
Sprinkle evenly over the tops of the scones. Place in the oven and bake for 25 minutes or until cooked and golden brown.
Preheat oven to 400 F with a rack in the lower-middle position.
Sift into a medium bowl by placing the flour in a fine-mesh strainer and tapping the strainer to pass the flour through.
Whisk into flour until incorporated.

Add the butter, toss to coat it in flour, and then smash the butter bits with your fingers. Continue smashing until the batter turns into a coarse, mealy substance and the butter is not particularly evident.
Add and stir to combine.
Stir in to form a soft dough. Move the dough to a lightly floured surface and pat it into a 7-inch disc. Cut into 6 equal wedges.
Place the parchment paper on a half sheet pan, add the scones, and sprinkle them with sugar. Bake for 25 minutes or until puffy and golden. Cool and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously for 30 seconds or longer to ensure that the drink is well-chilled. Strain into a chilled glass.
Garnish and serve.

Preheat your oven to 475 F and line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil. You might be tempted to use a glass or ceramic baking dish, but make sure to use metal - the peppers may leak hot liquid, creating zones of lower heat that can shatter nonmetal bakeware.

Place on the foil and move to the oven. Roast for 15 minutes; then, check the peppers. When they are blistered and blackened on one side, flip them and roast for another 5-20 minutes (the wide variance is due to the differing moisture content for different peppers). When the peppers are blackened all over, transfer them to a large mixing bowl and cover it tightly with foil. Let the peppers sit for 10 minutes to steam their skins off and cool down enough to handle. Remove the skins and seeds, and serve on bruschetta or use for whatever application suits your fancy.
Preheat your oven to 375 F.
Combine in the bowl of a food processor and process for 30 seconds or until the mixture turns to uniformly small crumbs.

Add and pulse until uniform. Remove the mixture to a springform pan and press it into the bottom and sides so that it comes about an inch and a half up the sides. Chill the crust for 15 minutes; then, bake it for 10 minutes. Cool completely and let the oven drop to 325 F.

Combine in the food processor. Process for 10 seconds, scrape down the sides, and process for another 10 seconds. Transfer to the prepared pie crust, move to the oven, and cook for 14-17 minutes, keeping a close eye on the pie and removing it when it has set up and is firm but jiggly in the center. Cool to room temperature; then, cool in the fridge. Remove it from the springform pan.
Combine in a mixing bowl and whip with a hand mixer until the foam holds stiff peaks.
Add and whisk until smooth and thick. Pipe onto the pie and serve.
Toss with the cooked shrimp and serve immediately.
Use the parchment paper to line two 9%22 X 5%22 loaf pans. Preheat your oven to 350 F with a rack in the lower-middle position.
Combine in a medium bowl and mash together. If the bananas do not readily mash%2C cover the bowl and let it sit for 30 minutes to soften the bananas%3B then%2C complete the mixing.

Combine in a stand mixer with the paddle attachment. Mix on low until the coconut oil is no longer evident in the mixture and it appears coarse and mealy. Add the mashed banana mixture and mix until the mass no longer shows dry flour.

Fold in with a rubber spatula and move the mixture to the prepared pans. Place in the oven for 45 minutes or until risen and golden brown. Cool completely%2C and serve. Reserve leftovers wrapped in foil for up to a few days.
Heat in a large saucepan on medium-low heat until shimmering.
Add and cook%2C stirring occasionally%2C until slightly softened%2C about 5 minutes.
Add and stir to combine. Cook for about 30 seconds to eliminate the raw taste of the flour.
Add%2C stir to combine%2C and bring to a simmer.
Add and bring the liquid back to a simmer. Cook for 7 minutes.
Stir in. Process with an immersion blender until very smooth and creamy. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a Collins glass and stir thoroughly until the sugar is dissolved.
Top off the glass and serve.

Combine in a large bowl and add adjust salt and pepper to taste. Fold gently with your hands to combine. Let the mixture marinate for 5 minutes%2C folding a couple more times to distribute the flavors. Serve immediately.
Melt in a dutch oven on medium-high heat. Swirling occasionally%2C cook the butter until it is a rich%2C nutty brown - 1 or 2 minutes.
Add and cook until well-browned and even on the verge of burning%2C about 10 minutes.
Add and cook until moderately softened%2C about 5 minutes.
Add%2C stir to combine%2C and cook for 1 minute.
Add and bring to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes or until the sunchokes are completely tender. Discard the bay leaves.
Process the soup with an immersion blender until it is very smooth and velvety. To improve the smoothness further%2C pass the soup through a fine-mesh strainer if desired.
Add to the soup%2C adjusting the amounts up or down to your taste.
Preheat oven to 400 F.

Remove any yellow%2C damaged%2C or discolored leaves from the outside of each sprout. Trim the root just slightly%2C and cut each sprout in half from top to bottom%2C leaving some of the root intact on each half.
Heat in a cast-iron skillet on medium heat until the oil is shimmering. Place the sprouts in the pan in a single layer%2C cut sides down.

Add%2C adjusting salt and pepper to your taste if desired. Cook until brown starts to form on the cut sides of the sprouts%3B then%2C transfer the pan to the oven. Roast them for 10-20 minutes or until the sprouts are tender and well-browned. Agitate the pan every 5 minutes while the sprouts are cooking.
Drizzle over the sprouts and serve immediately.
Place a highball glass in the freezer to chill.
Combine in a cocktail shaker and shake vigorously until the water is very well chilled and the outside of the shaker is almost painfully cold - this will take a minute or two.
Add to the chilled highball glass. Top up the glass with ice water strained out of the cocktail shaker. Enjoy all day and all night.
Combine in a cocktail shaker and stir until the liquid is very well chilled. Strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish and serve.
Fill a Collins glass with ice.
Add to the Collins glass.
Garnish and serve.
Preheat your oven to 300 F.
Combine the spices in a small bowl and stir to combine. Rub this spice mixture all over the lamb shanks.

Heat in a large dutch oven on medium-high heat until the oil shimmers. Add the lamb shanks and brown them on both sides for about 4 minutes or until they develop some color. Work in two batches if the shanks would crowd the pan. Move the shanks to a bowl or rimmed baking sheet.
Add and cook over medium heat until the vegetables start to soften and brown%2C about 8 minutes.
Add and cook for 1 minute.
Add and cook until the alcohol has burned off%2C about 2 minutes. Add the shanks and arrange them evenly%2C making sure to include any juices that collected in the dish with the lamb.
Add and bring to a simmer.

Cut into a circle that will fit in the dutch oven%2C and cut a small hole in the center of the circle. Place the parchment circle directly on the surface of the liquid and move the pan to the oven. Cook for 3 hours or until the lamb is very tender. Discard the rosemary and bay leaf.

Remove the lamb shanks and place them on a clean dish. Process the remaining liquid with an immersion blender until it is very smooth%3B then%2C pass it through a strainer and into a large bowl. Adjust the salt and pepper of the liquid to taste and ladle it on and around the lamb shanks to serve.
Fill a highball glass with ice.
Add to the glass and gently stir just to combine.
Garnish and serve.
Preheat your oven to 400 F.
Toss together in a big bowl. Move to a half sheet pan covered with foil and arrange in a single layer. Roast for 20 minutes or until browned and tender.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker and stir until very well-chilled. Strain into a highball glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in the bowl of a stand mixer and mix on low speed for 5 minutes or until a dough forms. Set aside in the refrigerator. Preheat your oven to 400 F with a rack in the lower-middle position.

Combine in the same bowl from the stand mixer and fold with a rubber spatula to combine. Move to a medium baking dish%2C cover with foil%2C and bake for 30 minutes or until the rhubarb is very wilted and juicy.

Combine in the same bowl from the stand mixer. Remove the rhubarb mixture from the oven once it is done cooking%2C and stir it well. Fold in the fresh%2C uncooked rhubarb and strawberries. Top with the prepared streusel from step 1 and bake for another 35 minutes or until the dish is very crisp and bubbly. Cool for at least 30 minutes and serve or cover with foil for up to 3 days.
Stir together in a highball glass filled with ice.
Pour over the back of a spoon onto the top of the cocktail, so the galliano floats atop the cocktail. Serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Stir until well-chilled and strain into a scotch or old-fashioned glass. Serve.
Stir well in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a large scotch glass and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into a highball glass.
Pour gently over the back of a spoon and into the drink so that it floats on top. Serve.
Combine in the carafe of a cream whipper.
Charge the cream whipper and let it sit for 5 minutes%3B then%2C strain out the cardamom%2C reserving the bourbon.
Combine in a cocktail glass filled with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a highball glass.
Fill the glass the rest of the way with seltzer%2C garnish with the lemon%2C and serve.
Combine in a large punch bowl and let sit for 30 minutes.
Add%2C stir gently to combine%2C and serve immediately.

Combine in a carafe or pitcher and process with your immersion blender until completely smooth. To serve%2C add a cup of the liquid at a time to a cocktail shaker with ice%2C shake%2C and strain evenly into two scotch glasses.
Combine in a cocktail shaker without ice and shake hard for 20 seconds. Add ice%2C shake for another 20 seconds%2C strain into an ice-filled glass%2C and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well to chill. Strain into a coupe glass and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a scotch glass filled with ice.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a scotch glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with no ice and shake hard for 20 seconds. Add ice%2C shake for another 20 seconds%2C and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a blender and blend for 10-15 seconds. Pour into a brandy snifter and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously for 30 seconds and strain into a chilled coupe glass. Serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Stir well to chill. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Stir to chill very well%3B then%2C strain into a cocktail glass.
Twist over the drink to express the oils in the lemon%3B then%2C drop the twist in the drink. Serve.
Add to a highball glass filled with ice%2C adjusting the seltzer up or down to taste. Serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well-chilled and strain into a Collins glass.
Garnish and serve.
Bring to a simmer in a small saucepan and cook until reduced by half. Refrigerate for at least one hour and up to a week.
Whip on medium speed in a stand mixer until slightly stiffened and foamy.
Add slowly to the mixer and continue to whip until medium peaks form. Set aside in the refrigerator until you make the rest of the drink.
Pulse in a blender along with the reduced cider until well-combined. Divide among four serving glasses%2C top with the whipped cream%2C and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake hard until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until very well chilled%2C strain into a cocktail glass%2C and serve.
Combine in a small saucepan and heat to dissolve the marmalade.
Fill a moderately-sized plastic container with water and freeze overnight%2C so you have one big ice cube.
Stir together in a punch bowl along with the prepared marmalade. If making ahead%2C you can refrigerate this mixture for up to 1 day.
Combine in the punch bowl%2C stir to combine%2C and serve%2C ladling into serving glasses with ice.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass filled with ice.
Garnish and serve.
Peel and juice the lime%2C adding both the zest and juice to a cocktail shaker filled with ice.
Add to the shaker%2C seal%2C and shake until well-chilled. Pour into a cocktail glass without straining.
Garnish and serve
Working one at a time%2C lightly toast the spices in a medium saucepan on high heat%2C making sure to agitate the pan constantly during toasting to avoid burning the spices.
Add and bring to a simmer. Simmer for 30 minutes%2C stirring occasionally. Strain the mixture into a jar and refrigerate for at least an hour and up to a week.
Add to a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into two cocktail glasses with a large ice cube in each and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Stir until very well-chilled. Strain into a pre-chilled cocktail glass and serve.
Combine in a jar%2C seal%2C and let sit at room temperature overnight. Use a fine-mesh strainer to remove the chicory.
Combine in a jar%2C seal%2C and shake to combine. Store for up to a week in the refrigerator.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass or coffee mug.
Garnish and serve.

Working quickly avoid curdling the egg in the acid of the accompanying liquid%2C add to a cocktail shaker with no ice and shake hard for 20 seconds. Add ice%2C and shake hard for another 20 seconds. Strain into two coupe glasses and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until very well-chilled and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve.
Combine with ice in a large pitcher and stir gently to combine. Pour into four separate chilled%2C salt-rimmed cocktail glasses.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until very well-chilled. Strain equally into two champagne flutes.
Top each glass and serve%2C adjusting the fizzy up or down depending on the dimensions of your particular glassware.
Add two dashes of bitters per drink and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake briefly to chill. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish and serve%2C adjusting the seltzer amount as needed to fill the glass.
Combine in a champagne flute and stir to combine.
Garnish and serve%2C adjusting the amount of champagne to the size of your glassware.
Combine in a cocktail glass filled with ice and stir to chill well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake for a full minute - don%27t skimp on the time. Strain into a chilled highball glass.
Add to top the glass%2C adjusting the amount of seltzer to the size of your glassware.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and shake for 10 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with a single%2C large ice cube. Stir until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
Melt in a small saucepan and cook for 5 minutes or until the butter is lightly browned and nutty.
Dissolve the sugar in the water.

Whisk together with the butter in a freezer-proof container. Move to the freezer for at least 1 hour and up to overnight. Once the butter is solid and floating on top of the bourbon%2C remove it and set it aside for another use %28it%27s great for roasting and sauteing vegetables%29. Strain the bourbon to ensure no butter bits remain.
Combine with the syrup and bourbon. Chill and serve in cocktail glasses.
Combine in a cocktail shaker without ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Add ice and shake to chill. Strain into a coupe glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass with a large ice cube.
Garnish and serve%2C twisting the orange over the drink to express its oils.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Stir vigorously until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve.

Combine the syrup and mint in the carafe of a cream whipper and charge it with the N2O cartridges according to directions. Let it sit for 5 minutes and then release the pressure%2C holding a glass over the nozzle to prevent spillage. Strain out the mint leaves and reserve the syrup.
Muddle in the bottom of a cocktail shaker using the back of a spoon or the pestle %28handheld%29 part of a mortar and pestle.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake vigorously to chill very well. Strain into a highball glass with ice.
Garnish and serve%2C adjusting the seltzer amount to your glassware.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice. Stir until well-chilled and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Twist over the drink to express the lemon oils%3B then%2C drop the lemon twist into the drink. Serve.
Add to a wine glass filled with ice and stir to combine.
Top off the drink and serve.

Gently muddle in the bottom of a cocktail glass using the back of a spoon or the pestle %28handheld%29 part of a mortar and pestle. Rub the muddled leaves all over the inside of the glass to ensure their oils are well-distributed.
Add and stir well to combine.
Add and stir well to chill the liquid. Top the glass off with a heaping mound of additional crushed ice. Serve with a straw and a mint sprig for garnish.
Combine in a cocktail shaker and muddle with the back of a spoon or the pestle %28handheld%29 part of a mortar and pestle.
Add to the cocktail shaker with ice and shake vigorously until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until very well-chilled%2C strain into a coupe glass%2C and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.

Combine in a small saucepan and cook on medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Continue simmering for 15 minutes. Remove from heat%2C cool%2C and strain into a heatproof vessel. Refrigerate for at least two hours or up to overnight.
Combine in a cocktail shaker with ice and shake until well-chilled. Strain evenly into two cocktail glasses.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well-chilled%3B then%2C strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously until well-chilled%3B then%2C strain into a chilled coupe glass. Serve.
Add to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until very well-chilled%3B then%2C strain into a chilled cocktail glass %28or a sour glass%2C if you%27ve got one%29.
Garnish and serve.
Combine in a small bowl and set aside.
Heat in a medium skillet on medium-high heat until just smoking.
Add to the pan and saute until the beans are just starting to get brown and spotty%2C 4-6 minutes.

Add%2C cover the pan%2C and cook until the beans are bright green and still crisp%2C 2-3 minutes. Remove the lid and cook until the water evaporates%2C 1-2 minutes. Add the reserved butter mixture and cook until the beans are lightly browned and beginning to become tender%2C 1-3 minutes. Transfer to a bowl.
Toss with the beans and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve.
Combine in a medium bowl and whisk until the sugar is dissolved. Set aside. You can use chashu pork broth in place of this entire mixture%2C if desired.
Bring to a boil in a medium saucepan.

Pierce each egg on the fat%2C less-pointed end with a thumbtack. Carefully lower the eggs into the hot water and reduce the heat to a bare simmer%2C 190 F. Cook for 6 minutes. Drain the eggs and run them under cool water. With the water running%2C carefully peel the eggs%2C taking care not to damage the whites%2C which will be very delicate.

Move the peeled eggs to a bowl and pour the liquid over them. To keep the eggs evenly marinating%2C place a layer of paper towels over them and ensure it is saturated with marinade. Place the bowl in the fridge for at least 4 hours and up to overnight%3B then%2C drain the marinade%2C place the eggs in a container%2C and refrigerate them for up to 3 days. Reheat in warm broth to serve.
Lay on a plastic cutting board%2C skin side down. Roll up the slab of pork belly with skin-side out.
Secure the pork belly at three-quarter-inch intervals. Preheat oven to 275 F.

Combine in a medium saucepan on high heat until boiling. Add the pork belly and partially lid so that some vapor can escape. Transfer to the oven and cook%2C turning the pork occasionally%2C until it is fully tender and a paring knife meets little resistance when inserted into the roll - 3 to 4 hours. Remove the entire contents of the pot to a heatproof%2C sealed container and refrigerate for 3 hours.

When ready to serve%2C remove the pork from the broth and reserve the broth for another use such as marinating ramen eggs. Slice the pork into thin rounds%2C char them with a blowtorch%2C and add to ramen to warm and serve.
Place in a strainer and run under tap water until the water runs clear. Move to a medium saucepan.
Add to the saucepan%2C bring to a boil%2C and cover. Turn the heat to its lowest setting and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let rest for 10 minutes.
Combine in a small saucepan and cook over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved.

Spread the rice out in the bottom of a 13 X 9 baking dish. With a small fan aimed at the rice to ventilate it%2C pour 3/4 of the vinegar mixture over the rice. Using a rice paddle or wooden spoon%2C gently fold the vinegar mixture into the rice%2C taking care not to smash the grains. When the grains have become glossy and stick together when squeezed%2C taste the rice and add more of the vinegar mixture if desired. Cover with a clean damp dish towel or plastic wrap directly on the surface of the rice and keep at room temperature while preparing sushi.
Toast lightly over a gas flame%2C just until pliable - about 5 seconds each.

Lay a strip of nori on your sushi mat with an inch of space on the part of the mat closest to you%2C ensuring the shiny side is down and the perforations are aligned vertically %28against the grain of the sushi mat%29. Spread 3/4 cup of prepared rice on the mat%2C distributing it evenly but not compressing it. Leave a 1/2%22 border along the top and bottom of the sheet. Repeat with the remaining nori.

Arrange fillings along the bottom third of the mats%2C taking care not to overstuff them. Lift the edge of the sushi mat closest to you and fold the nori and rice over the arranged fillings. Continue to roll%2C pulling the mat toward you as it engulfs the sushi%2C and ensuring the mat itself does not get rolled into the sushi. At the end%2C moisten the exposed top edge of the nori and gently close the sushi on itself. Cut the roll in half%2C and cut each half into thirds%2C yielding six pieces.
Serve with the prepared sushi rolls.
Combine in a blender and process for 5 seconds. Pour into a chilled cocktail glass and serve.
Toast half the green tea leaves%3B then%2C combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan and bring to a bare simmer.
Whisk in a medium bowl until uniform and somewhat lightened in color.

Add to the yolks and whisk vigorously until the mixture is lightened in color and falls off the whisk in long ribbons. Add 1 cup of the hot milk mixture to the eggs and whisk to combine. Add the remaining milk and whisk to combine%2C taking care to scrape the edges of the mixing bowl. Return the entire mixture to the pan and cook until slightly thickened%2C which will be around 170 degrees F.

Strain the mixture into a large bowl%2C cover%2C and move to your refrigerator. Let cool for at least 4 hours or until the mixture reaches 40 degrees F. Process in your ice cream maker and serve immediately for soft-serve consistency%2C or freeze for 4 hours for firmer consistency.
Combine in a medium saucier and bring to a simmer on medium heat. Once bubbling%2C cover and shut off the heat. Steep for 30 minutes.
Whisk together in a medium bowl.

Add to the sugar and cornstarch mixture and whisk to combine. Return the milk to a simmer and remove the vanilla bean%2C leaving the pulp behind. When the milk is simmering%2C add a half cup of it to the eggs and whisk to combine. Add another half cup%2C and whisk to combine%2C then return the entire egg mixture back to the saucier on the oven. Continue to cook until the mixture is sludgy and thick and bubbling%2C and then cook for an additional 2 minutes. Remove from heat.

Stir into the custard and move it to a baking dish%2C spreading it out to increase the surface area and speed cooling. Press plastic wrap directly onto the surface of the custard and refrigerate for 1 hour.

Move to a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on medium speed for 5 minutes or until light and fluffy. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and switch from the paddle attachment to the whisk attachment. Turn the mixer on to medium speed%2C and add the pudding gradually%2C a quarter cup at a time.

Drizzle in with the mixer running. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and mix again for 10 seconds to incorporate. It should be light and creamy%2C but stiff enough to hang from a spoon without running off in long ribbons like a liquid. Use immediately or seal in a zip-top bag and refrigerate for up to a week.
Preheat oven to 350 F with a rack in the middle position.
Spread on a baking sheet and toast in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove and cool them completely.
Peel%2C trim%2C and shred the carrots%3B then%2C measure 24 ounces or 6 packed cups and reserve%2C discarding the remainder.

Melt in a medium saucepan. Simmer%2C stirring with a heatproof spatula to ensure no solids burn on the bottom of the pan%2C until the bubbling dies down and the butter is a rich yellow. Move the liquid and solids to a heatproof vessel. Refrigerate for up to a week if not using immediately.
Lightly grease three 8-inch cake pans and cover their interiors with parchment. If you have only one pan%2C this recipe can be made in stages.

Combine in a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Mix on low to combine%3B then%2C increase the speed to high and whip until fluffy%2C about 8 minutes. Drizzle in the melted%2C browned butter in a steady%2C thin stream. Reduce speed to low.
Add to the mixer and mix until smooth. When well-incorporated%2C fold in the pecans and carrots with a rubber spatula.

Spread the batter equally among the three cake pans. Bake until the cakes are golden%2C about 45 minutes. Remove%2C run a knife around the edges of each pan%2C and remove to a cooling rack. When cool%2C level the cakes with a long knife.
Spread 1 cup between each layer and the remaining frosting on the outside of the cake. Smooth the exterior with an offset spatula. Devour.
Pour onto a large%2C clean work surface in a mound and create a 4-inch well in the center.

Add to the well and stir with a fork to combine. Gradually work in flour from the edges of the well until the liquid in the center starts to thicken. Using a board scraper%2C gradually work in the remaining flour until you have a large mass. Because eggs vary slightly in size and moisture content%2C your pasta may be too sticky or too dry at this point - if it is too sticky%2C add a teaspoon of extra flour at a time until it firms up%3B if it is too dry%2C wet your hands while working the dough and repeat until the dough takes on a doughy consistency.  Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let it sit on the counter for 30 minutes to hydrate the flour.

Cut the dough ball into equal quarters and place them under a towel so they don%27t dry out. Press one of the dough quarters through the pasta roller on its widest setting. Fold it over itself and repeat. Dust the now-flattened dough liberally with flour%2C reduce the roller width by 1 increment%2C and roll again. Repeat%2C reducing the roller width each time%2C until the dough reaches your desired thickness and is slightly translucent. Cut the flat dough sheet into 12-inch segments and either pass them through the pasta cutter on your pasta machine%2C or cut them with a knife into fettuccine noodles.

Bring to a boil in a large stock pot. When the water is at a rolling boil%2C add the pasta and cook for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until the pasta is just al dente %28the cooking period will be much shorter than for dried pasta%29. Drain%2C toss with your favorite sauce%2C and serve.
Combine in a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer. Cook for 2 minutes once simmering to fully hydrate the agar. Reduce heat to medium-low.
Pour slowly into the hot orange juice%2C never letting the temperature drop below 95 F - at this temperature%2C the agar will begin to solidify. Remove from heat.
Combine in a bowl and set the saucepan in it. Gently swirl the pan to chill the contents. Let the pan sit until the contents resemble curds and the liquid is cool to the touch.

Place a very clean tea towel in a strainer on top of a clean saucepan. Pour the orange juice mixture into the towel and let it drain for a minute or two. Gather the corners of the tea towel%2C lift it%2C and very gently twist it to encourage more liquid to flow out. Do not squeeze too hard or you will start to extract cloudy portions of the liquid and your juice won%27t be clear. Remove the clarified liquid to a stopper-top bottle and chill in the refrigerator for up to a week.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously until very well-chilled and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.
Lightly toast all spices in a very hot skillet. Cool the spices and place all of them%2C except the cinnamon%2C in a spice bag.
Bring to a bare simmer in a medium saucepan. Transfer to a slow cooker on its low setting. Add toasted spices to slow cooker.
Juice the orange and add the juice and the remaining orange peel to the pot. Cover and steep for 2 hours.
Add to the wine%2C cook for a final 30 minutes%2C and serve.

Preheat oven to 275 F. Cut the bread into 3/4%22 cubes%2C spread them evenly in a single layer on two rimmed baking sheets%2C and move the sheets to the oven. Roast for 50 minutes or until the bread is well-toasted. Stir and rearrange the bread several times during cooking to prevent burning and brown the bread evenly. When the bread has finished cooking%2C increase the oven temperature to 350 F.
Melt in a large dutch oven and cook until the foaming subsides%2C but stop short of browning the butter.
Add%2C mash into small pieces%2C and cook for 8 minutes or until no pink remains.
Add and cook for 10 minutes or until softened. Remove from heat.
Add to sausage mixture.
Whisk in a medium bowl until homogenous. Stirring constantly to avoid scrambling the eggs%2C whisk into the sausage mixture. Add the toasted bread and fold gently to combine.

Move the mixture to a large%2C buttered baking dish and cover tightly with aluminum foil. Cook for 45 minutes%3B then%2C remove the foil and cook for an additional 15-20 minutes or until the bread is golden and crisp. Remove from the oven%2C cool for 5 minutes%2C and serve.
Preheat oven to 300 F.

Dry with paper towels. Trim any excess fat hanging off the duck. Remove and reserve the giblets. Thoroughly salt and pepper the outside of the duck%2C tuck the wingtips under the bird%2C and tie the legs together. Place the bird in a roasting pan%2C breast side up%2C and roast for 1 hour or until the skin begins to leech fat. Flip the duck and roast for another hour. Flip once more so the breast side is again up%2C and roast for another 30 minutes or until the duck begins to brown. Remove the duck from the oven and boost the heat to 425 F.

Combine in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer. Cook briefly%2C just until the ginger becomes fragrant. Once the oven has heated for 15 minutes%2C place the duck back in it %28without the glaze%29 and cook for 10 minutes. Brush the glaze onto the exterior of the duck%2C and roast for a final 5 minutes or until the glaze is sticky. Remove%2C cool%2C and serve. Reserve the duck fat for other uses.

Preheat oven to 300 F. Arrange half the potatoes on each sheet of foil and bring the edges together%2C crimping very tightly to seal. Roast for 2 hours or until a skewer can enter the potatoes with no resistance. Set aside until cool enough to handle.
Melt in a medium saucepan. cook the butter until it is slightly browned and faintly nutty.
Add to the butter and immediately remove from heat %28there may be a bit of splattering%29. Set the butter aside.

Peel the sweet potatoes and discard their skins. Add to the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and beat until fluffy%2C about 2 minutes. Strain the butter into the potatoes%2C discarding the herbs.
Beat into the potatoes and salt to taste. Heat the oven to 375 F. Scoop the potatoes into a large baking dish and smooth with a rubber spatula. Bake until heated through%2C about 30 minutes.
Add to the top of the dish and boost the heat to 475 F. Cook for another 3 minutes or until the marshmallows are lightly browned. Cool and serve.

Preheat oven to 425 F. Toss the ingredients together in a large bowl and arrange with plenty of space on 2 rimmed baking sheets. Roast for 40 minutes or until well-browned. Use a spatula to turn the veggies twice during cooking.
Melt in a large saucepan on medium-high heat until just starting to brown.
Add to the butter%2C reduce the heat to medium-low%2C and cook until tender and just beginning to brown%2C about 10 minutes.

Add to the onions along with the roasted squash and carrots. Use part of the stock to deglaze the baking sheets%2C transferring the brown bits to the saucepan along with the stock. Bring to a simmer and cook until the vegetables are very soft%2C about 10 minutes. Discard the thyme and bay leaf. Process with an immersion blender until very smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cool and serve.
Preheat oven to 400 F.

Place on a baking sheet lined with foil and move to the oven for 15 minutes. Flip the peppers and roast for another 10-15 minutes or until the peppers are thoroughly blistered and roasted. Remove the peppers to a heatproof bowl and cover them in foil so steam can loosen their skins.
Melt in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add to the butter and cook for 5-7 minutes or until softened but not browned.
Add and cook for 1-2 minutes or until fragrant.
Add and cook for 2 minutes or until the flour is beginning to brown a little.

Add and bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 minutes. Meanwhile%2C remove the skins and seeds from the peppers and chop them roughly. After the 10 minutes of simmering%2C add the peppers and cook briefly to warm them. Process the mixture with an immersion blender until it is very smooth. Salt to taste.
Garnish and serve.
Preheat oven to 325 F. Lightly butter a 9-inch springform pan and set it aside.
Combine in a microwave-proof bowl and microwave in 20-second bursts%2C stirring between each burst%2C until melted and incorporated.
Add to the chocolate mixture%2C stir to combine%2C and set aside.
Add to the bowl of a stand mixer and whip on medium-low speed for 1 minute or until slightly foamy. Increase the speed to medium-high.
Gradually add to the running mixer and continue to whip for about 4 minutes or until the egg whites are glossy and support stiff peaks. Transfer the whites to a large bowl.
Add to the empty mixer bowl and whip for 3 minutes or until pale yellow and thick. Scrape down the bowl and add the reserved chocolate mixture. Mix just until incorporated%2C about 15 seconds.

Add and mix until incorporated%2C about 30 seconds. Scrape down the sides of the bowl and add 1/3 of the reserved egg whites. Mix on medium-low speed until fully incorporated%3B then%2C scrape the batter into the bowl with the rest of the whites. Gently fold the mixture with a rubber spatula until no white streaks remain. Pour the batter into the prepared springform pan%2C smooth its surface%2C and place the pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake for 50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out mostly clean. Cool for 20 minutes.
Place in a sifter and lightly tap it over the surface of the cake to dust it with sugar. Serve.

Arrange your oven with both racks in the lowest position. On the bottom rack%2C place a rimmed baking sheet with hot water to create steam. On the upper rack%2C place an empty cast-iron skillet. Preheat the oven to 375 F.

Trim the leaves from the exterior of the cauliflower. Using a small knife%2C trim the small leaves attached to the stem of the cauliflower%2C and adjust the stem and bottom so the vegetable will sit flat on a pan. Leave the overall head as intact as possible

Rub the oil all over the cauliflower head and sprinkle evenly with salt. Place the plant on the hot cast-iron skillet%2C core side down%2C and roast for 1-2 hours or until the cauliflower is tender all the way through. To brown the exterior%2C it may be necessary to boost the heat at the end of cooking%2C or to use the broiler.
Garnish and serve.
Preheat oven to 425 F.

Combine and place on a large piece of aluminum foil. Crimp the foil around the beets%2C forming a tight pouch%2C and roast in the oven for about an hour or until the beets are easily pierced with a paring knife. Remove%2C cool%2C and chop into 1/2%22 pieces.
Combine in a jar%2C seal%2C and shake well.
Toss with half the vinaigrette and add more vinaigrette to your taste. Divide evenly among 4 plates and add the beets evenly to each plate.
Divide evenly among the plates and serve.

In a julep cup or large rocks glass%2C muddle cucumber round and jalape%C3%B1o until they are well crushed and juices are expressed. Add basil leaves and agave syrup and muddle until basil is lightly bruised%2C then swab the glass%27s sides with the basil. Add mezcal and stir well. Half-fill glass with crushed ice and stir to combine. Fill glass completely with crushed ice and stir until outside of glass frosts. Add more crushed ice%2C heaping generously%2C then garnish with sprigs of fresh basil and cucumber stick. Serve.

In a cocktail glass%2C muddle ginger until it is well crushed and juices are expressed. Add mint leaves and maple syrup and muddle until mint is lightly bruised%2C then swab the glass%27s sides with the mint. Add rum and stir well. Half-fill glass with crushed ice and stir to combine. Fill glass completely with crushed ice and stir until outside of glass frosts. Add more crushed ice%2C heaping generously%2C then garnish with sprigs of fresh mint. Serve.
Add lime, Green Chartreuse, Gran Classico, and gin to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 12 seconds, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Combine hot coffee%2C fernet%2C and simple syrup in a prewarmed mug or cocktail glass. Using a spoon%2C dollop whipped cream on top of coffee and top with lemon zest. Serve right away.

Add simple syrup%2C lime juice%2C cura%C3%A7ao%2C rum%2C and Angostura to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 12 seconds. Strain into a Champagne flute and top with sparkling wine.

Add sweet vermouth%2C Braulio%2C rye%2C and lemon bitters to a mixing glass and stir with ice until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass%2C garnish with lemon twist%2C and serve.

Add Madeira%2C simple syrup%2C and lemon to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 12 seconds. Double-strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with freshly grated nutmeg and serve.
Add rye whiskey%2C Campari%2C Ramazzotti%2C cura%C3%A7ao%2C and bitters to a rocks glass and add ice. Stir until well chilled%2C garnish with orange twist%2C and serve.
Add apple brandy, sweet vermouth, and Campari to an ice-filled Old Fashioned glass. Stir until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Express lemon oils over drink and add lemon twist. Serve immediately.
Add vermouth%2C Cynar%2C and Scotch to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled%2C then strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with grapefruit twist and serve immediately.
Fill a Collins glass with ice. Add sparkling water, vermouth, rum, and 1/2 ounce lime. Stir gently. Taste and add more lime if desired. Garnish and serve immediately.

In a bowl%2C combine pineapple juice%2C lime juice%2C cucumber juice%2C sugar%2C and chili powder. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved. Season with salt. Chill  by stirring with ice briefly and then straining. Serve alongside some nice tequila.

In a bowl%2C combine grapefruit juice%2C lime juice%2C honey%2C and chipotle chili powder and stir until honey is thoroughly combined. Season with salt. Chill by stirring with ice briefly and then straining. Serve in a shot glass alongside some nice tequila.

In a bowl%2C combine orange juice%2C lime juice%2C pomegranate juice%2C sugar%2C and chili powder and stir until sugar is dissolved. Taste and adjust lime%2C sugar%2C chili powder%2C or other ingredients if desired. Chill by stirring with ice briefly and then straining. Serve in a shot glass alongside some nice tequila.

In a blender%2C combine Clamato%2C cilantro%2C lemon juice%2C onion%2C jalapeno%2C coriander seed%2C and Worcestershire sauce. Blend at high speed until solids are thoroughly blended into liquid. Season with salt. Chill by stirring with ice briefly and then straining. Serve in a shot glass alongside some nice tequila.

Add whiskey, sweet vermouth, and Barolo Chinato to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass, adding one ice cube. Express orange oil from twist over cocktail and discard. Serve immediately.
Combine vodka, lemon, marmalade, and honey syrup in cocktail shaker. Fill shaker with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into chilled coupe glass.
Combine all ingredients in an ice-filled shaker. Shake until well chilled, about 10 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled double old fashioned glass.

Add cognac%2C Old Tom gin%2C sweet vermouth%2C and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled%2C about 30 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and serve immediately.
Fill a glass about two thirds full of ice. Add whiskey and amaretto. Stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into ice-filled rocks glass. Serve

Add whiskey%2C sweet vermouth%2C cura%C3%A7ao%2C lime juice%2C and bitters to a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime twist.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add tart cherry juice concentrate, Cointreau, lime juice, and vodka. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lime slice or twist and serve.
Add tequila, Cardamaro, lemon juice, and fig preserves to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the beet juice, carrot juice, balsamic vinegar, Carpano Antica, and bourbon. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain evenly into 2 ice-filled cocktail glasses and serve.

Add the Plymouth gin, Barolo Chinato, and Peychaud%27s bitters to a mixing glass. Fill 2/3 full with ice and stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with the lime twist and whole star anise, then serve.
Fill a rocks glass with ice. Add Scotch%2C Drambuie%2C and bitters. Stir thoroughly and serve.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the pomegranate juice%2C ginger liqueur%2C and apple brandy. Shake until well-chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain evenly into two coupe glasses. Top each glass with one ounce cider and serve.

Pour the whiskey%2C sweet vermouth%2C and Fernet Branca into a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir until outside of mixing glass is very cold to touch%2C about 15 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass and serve.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add gin, Chartreuse, and lime juice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into cocktail glass and serve.

In a cocktail shaker, muddle cantaloupe until broken down. Fill shaker with ice. Add basil, tequila, Aperol, agave syrup, and grapefruit juice and shake vigorously. Strain into ice filled serving glass (or tin cowboy cup). Garnish with lemon wheel.
Stir Cocchi, vermouth, celery juice, and lemon juice in a pitcher. Divide between ice-filled glasses. Garnish each glass with a marjoram sprig.
Add gin, dry vermouth, sweet vermouth, orange juice, and bitters to an ice-filled cocktail shaker. Shake until well chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange wheel and serve.
Fill a tall chimney-style glass nearly full of crushed ice. Add the lime peel%2C lime juice%2C bitters%2C and simple syrup. Top with Genever and stir. Serve.
In a large pitcher, combine Campari, tequila, and tangerine juice. Fill pitcher with ice, top with seltzer, and gently stir to combine. Serve with tangerine wedges in each glass.

In a blender combine peaches, water, sugar, and Aperol. Blend on high speed until completely smooth, about 2 minutes. Pour 2 tablespoons of the mixture into each glass, add a small amount of sparkling wine to loosen the puree, then fill glasses completely. Garnish each glass with a lemon slice.
Pour the Cynar then the grapefruit juice into a Champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine. Serve immediately.

Combine vodka, cranberry sorbet, lime juice, and Cointreau in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, top with sparkling wine, and serve.

Add rye, Amaro, apple cider, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Fill a rocks glass with ice. Strain cocktail into serving glass and serve immediately.

Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add gin, lime, lemon, simple syrup, and mint leaves. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Strain into ice-filled serving glass or mason jar, top with soda water. Garnish with mint sprig and serve immediately.
Combine white vermouth, calvados, lemon juice, and celery shrub bitters in a mixing glass. Add ice and stir until chilled. Strain into an Old Fashioned glass and serve immediately, straight up.

Place cucumber slices in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Add tequila, vermouth, lime juice, Chartreuse, simple syrup. Shake well until chilled. Strain into large ice-filled serving glass and serve with two straws.
Fill a mixing glass with ice and add all ingredients. Stir for 15 seconds, then strain into chilled cocktail glass. Serve straight up.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir for 15 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve straight up.
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake for 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve straight up.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker. Fill with ice and shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Strain into a coupe glass. Serve.

Add lime, simple syrup, Campari, pineapple juice, and rum to a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until cocktail is quite cold, about 30 seconds. Serve in a Moscow Mule mug or old fashioned glass over a large ice cube.
Pour the grapefruit juice and Domain de Canton in a champagne glass. Gently pour the prosecco over top until glass is nearly full. Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir well. Strain into ice-filled highball glass.
Fill cocktail shaker with ice, add lime juice, bitters, Aperol, sweet vermouth, and tequila. Shake well and strain into a cocktail glass. Serve immediately.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add rum, King%27s Ginger, lime juice, and Angostura. Shake well and strain into an ice-filled old fashioned glass. Top with ginger beer and garnish with lime twist.
Fill mixing glass halfway with ice. Add vodka, Lillet Blanc, and grapefruit juice. Stir until cold. Strain into ice-filled glass. Garnish with orange slice.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add genever%2C Cointreau%2C tangerine juice%2C and orange bitters. Shake well and strain into an ice filled rocks glass.
Combine rum, calvados, falernum, lemon, and bitters in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with lemon wheel.
Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add whiskey%2C creme de cacao%2C and bitters. Stir for thirty seconds%2C then strain into a coupe glass.

In a large punch bowl or beverage dispenser%2C mix gin%2C Aperol%2C Chartreuse%2C lime juice%2C grapefruit juice%2C and orange juice. Add bitters and stir. Add several cups of ice%2C stir%2C and let chill%2C 15 minutes. Ice should dilute the punch slightly. Top with sparkling wine%2C stir gently%2C and garnish with orange slices. Serve over additional ice.

Combine Scotch%2C honey syrup%2C and the juice of one lemon wedge in a glass. Add hot water. Garnish with one cinnamon stick%2C star anise%2C allspice berries%2C and one coin of orange peel studded with cloves.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add tequila, pear liqueur, allspice dram, and lemon. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with pear and serve.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add tequila, Velvet Falernum, mezcal, Punt e Mes, and lime juice. Shake for 30 seconds and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lime twist.
Fill a mixing glass with ice. Add wine, apple brandy, sloe gin, maple syrup, and bitters. Stir well and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish and serve.
Stir applejack, sweet vermouth, sloe gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup with ice until well chilled. Strain into a chilled coupe.
Add a few ice cubes to a serving glass. Pour in rum, apricot nectar, and lime juice, then top with ginger beer. Stir lightly and serve immediately.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add rum, lime juice, agave, grapefruit juice, and bitters and shake well. Strain into an ice-filled Collins glass.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well until chilled, about 10 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Fill a highball glass with ice. Add%2C in layers%2C the lime juice%2C then the ginger beer%2C then the ginger beer. Serve with a straw.

Fill a 10-ounce glass with ice. Scatter salt on the ice, then pour in the tequila, hot sauce, Clamato, and lemon juice. Top up the glass with grapefruit soda and stir gently. Garnish with lemon and serve immediately.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well until chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients with ice and stir until well-chilled. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Pour both vermouths into an old fashioned glass over ice.  Stir, twist lemon peel over drink, and drop in.
Fill a rocks glass with ice. Pour the rum over the ice and stir gently. Pour the cider on top of the rum. Combine with a quick stir and serve.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well until chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist lemon peel over drink and use as garnish.

Combine liquid ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well to chill, about 30 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist lemon peel over drink to express oils, and use as garnish.

Combine butter, zest, and almond extract in small bowl and mash with fork until well blended. Pour 2 ounces rum into four small coffee mugs. Add 1 tablespoon of the butter mixture to each. Top with just-boiled water and stir until butter is melted. Add honey to taste (about 2 teaspoons is normal). Garnish with orange twist and serve immediately.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds; strain into Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Twist orange peel over drink and use as garnish.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 20 to 30 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Fill a highball glass with ice. Add liquor, top with club soda or ginger ale or a combination of both. Do what comes natural.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds, and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Place rocks glass in freezer at least 15 minutes before starting to make cocktail. Fill mixing glass 2/3rds full with ice. Add Fernet and Campari. Stir until drink is well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into chilled rocks glass. Serve.

Add mezcal, whiskey, Benedictine, and bitters to mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into ice-filled Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with apple slice and serve.
Combine ros%C3%A9%2C cr%C3%A8me de cassis%2C simple syrup%2C sparkling water%2C and frozen berries in a large pitcher. Serve immediately.
Combine all ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake for 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve straight up.

Mix the rum, brandy, orange juice, lime juice, simple syrup, rosemary, Angostura, and a pinch of cardamom in a punch bowl or very large pitcher. Taste and add more cardamom if desired. Garnish with slices of orange, lemon, and lime.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add bourbon%2C lime%2C sweet vermouth%2C and Grand Marnier and shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wedge or mint leaf.
Combine bourbon, lime, allspice dram, bitters, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well until chilled, about 10 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime wedge, if desired.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds; strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Combine ingredients in a tall glass and fill with crushed ice. Swizzle with a bar spoon until a frost forms on the outside of the glass. The ice will settle as you do this%3B add more crushed ice to fill%2C garnish with a mint sprig.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Wash and stem the strawberries and cut them in half (or in quarters if your berries are large). Place the cut berries in a quart-size jar, adding until the jar is about three-quarters full. Add tequila until the berries are completely covered. Store the jar in a cool place and let the mixture soak for three weeks, agitating the jar every day or so. After three weeks, taste the mixture; let soak for a few days more if necessary, otherwise strain through cheesecloth, lightly pressing the berry pulp to extract the last drops of infused tequila. Keep refrigerated, and use within a couple of weeks.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.

Combine gin (and simply syrup, if using) and bitters in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Gently pour the port down the inside of the cocktail glass, allowing it to slide down the side and settle in the bottom of the drink. Twist a piece of orange or lemon peel over the drink, but don%27t drop it in, as that will ruin the visual effect.

Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker (you may wish to stir it a little, so the maple syrup dissolves in the rest of the liquid), then fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and pour, unstrained, into a tall glass, adding more ice to fill the glass, if needed. Garnish with a lime wedge and an orange slice speared to a cherry.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well to chill, and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Pour diluted honey to an old fashioned glass and add rum and bitters, if desired; stir to combine. Fill glass with ice and stir until chilled.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Combine orange juice%2C gin and Cherry Heering in a mixing glass%2C fill with ice and stir to chill. Strain into a champagne flute and top with chilled Champagne. Garnish with a spiral-cut piece of orange peel.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 30 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cinnamon stick or a piece of star anise.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange peel.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker, and fill with ice. Shake well, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

The Contessa is comfortable in two variations: for the first, simply combine the ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice; stir well for 20 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. For the second variation, stir with ice as above and strain into a rocks or old fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Either way, be sure to twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass or coupe.
Fill a Delmonico or Old Fashioned glass with ice and add ingredients. Stir briefly to mix and chill, and garnish with a grapefruit twist.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a thin wedge of lime.
Rinse a heavy mug with boiling water, then add sugar. Add water and stir until sugar is dissolved, then add whisky or your chosen spirit.
Combine gin, lemon juice, and honey syrup in a cocktail shaker, stir briefly to dissolve honey syrup, then fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a bar glass and add cracked ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glasses.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist.

Using a wooden muddler or the back of a wooden spoon%2C lightly bruise the mint leaves in the bottom of a tall chimney or highball glass%2C gently rubbing the leaves along the sides of the glass to coat with the fragrant oil. Add remaining ingredients to the glass and fill with crushed ice. Using a bar spoon%2C swizzle the drink by gently twirling the spoon between the palms of your hands%2C adding additional crushed ice as needed. Continue until a layer of frost develops on the outside of the glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint%2C spear with a straw and serve.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

In a rocks or old-fashioned glass%2C pour the cane syrup and squeeze the lime slice%2C which has been cut from the side of the fruit so that the aromatic oils from the peel will flavor the drink. Add the rum and stir until syrup is dissolved%3B add a few large cubes of ice and briefly stir to chill.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice%3B stir well for 20-30 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
Fill a highball glass with ice. Add rum%2C top with coconut water. Insert straw. Relax.
Pour Campari and vermouth into an ice-filled highball glass; top with club soda. Garnish with an orange wheel.
Introduce all ingredients to a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake well for 10 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass%3B garnish with an orange wheel.
Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve.
Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice. Stir well for 30 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a piece of orange or lemon peel, or nothing at all.
Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink and use for garnish.
Pour ingredients into mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir briskly for 30 seconds%3B strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Add the vermouth, Cointreau and bitters to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Gently pour the whiskey over a bar spoon so it floats on the surface of the drink, then twist a piece of lemon peel over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Pour ingredients into a mixing glass and fill with ice; stir well for 30 seconds, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Shake with ice and pour%2C unstrained%2C into an Old Fashioned glass. Garnish with spiral-cut orange and lemon peels.

Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker and fill with ice%3B shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass %28you can instead pour it over shaved ice in an old fashioned glass%2C if you prefer%29. Garnish with a fresh mint leaf.
Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker%3B fill with ice and shake well for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice%2C and shake briskly for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Pour ingredients into a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir briskly for 30 seconds; strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a large piece of lemon peel over the drink, and use the twist as garnish.
Pour ingredients into a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir briskly for 30 seconds%2C then strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry or a twist of lemon peel.
Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker, fill with ice and shake well for 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass; garnish with a lemon twist.

In a mixing glass half full of ice%2C stir together Zucca%2C Scotch%2C and bitters until chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Add soda and lemon juice to mixing glass and give one gentle stir. Strain%2C dividing between two highball glasses filled with ice. Garnish with lemon twist and serve immediately.

Add the mezcal%2C vermouth%2C Yellow Chartreuse%2C and bitters to a mixing glass. Fill 2/3 full with ice and stir until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass%2C garnish with the grapefruit twist and serve.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker filled 2/3 with ice. Shake hard for 30 seconds to incorporate and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish according to your own inner tiki style.

Bring apple cider to a simmer in a medium saucepan. Add rye%2C Campari%2C and vermouth%2C stir until warm. Divide between two heatproof mugs or glass serving glasses%2C garnish with orange twist and serve immediately.

Pour gin%2C vermouth%2C absinthe%2C and creme de violette into an ice-filled. Stir until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass%2C add lemon twist%2C and serve immediately.
Add rum%2C rye%2C brandy%2C grenadine%2C and lemon juice to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and serve.
Add all ingredients to shaker. Add ice and shake well. Strain into a chilled coupe.
In an Old Fashioned glass, stir Cynar, Punt e Mes, lemon juice, and orange bitters with a large ice cube until chilled. Add salt on top of ice and serve.

Combine the vodka%2C lemon juice%2C and sugar in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a lemon twist.

In a cocktail shaker, muddle cucumber rounds in simple syrup until mixture is an even paste. Add lemon, Pimm%27s, and rye, and fill shaker with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with cucumber ribbon if desired.
In a mixing glass, stir together whiskey, Pimm%27s, pistachio liqueur, and Tawny Port with ice until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist.
Add rye%2C Cynar%2C simple syrup%2C and bitters to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into two coupe glasses and serve immediately.
Fill a mixing glass with ice. Add rye%2C Averna%2C Scotch%2C Gran Classico%2C and bitters. Stir for 30 seconds%2C or until well chilled. Strain into a coupe.
Add the vermouths and absinthe into a mixing glass. Fill with ice and stir until cold, 15 to 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist and serve straight up.
Stir rye, Lillet Blanc, apple brandy, Chatreuse, and bitters with ice and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.

Combine tequila (or sotol), Benedictine, Lillet, and bitters in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 30 seconds. Strain into chilled coupe glass; twist lemon peel over drink and use as garnish.
Combine bourbon, lime, allspice dram, bitters, and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well and strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Fill a cocktail shaker 2/3 full with ice. Add Aperol, gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and bitters. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with orange twist.
Combine rye%2C vermouth%2C absinthe%2C and bitters in an ice-filled mixing glass. Stir until well-chilled. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass and garnish with an orange slice.
Fill a mixing glass with ice. Add mezcal, Zucca, sweet vermouth, and mole bitters. Stir until well chilled. Strain into an ice-filled rocks glass and garnish with orange twist.
Combine tea, ice, rum, cane syrup, and lemon (if using) in a large pitcher just before serving. Stir well and serve in ice-filled glasses, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Fill a mixing glass with ice. Add tequila, Bonal, and creme de cacao. Stir until well chilled. Strain into serving glass and serve up; garnish with a lemon twist, flamed if desired.
Fill a mixing glass with ice and add vermouth, Dubonnet, Cointreau, and orange bitters. Stir until chilled and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist and serve immediately.
Fill a mixing glass with ice. Add gin, vermouth, Cocchi Americano, and sherry. Stir until well chilled. Strain into a cocktail glass, garnish with lemon twist, and serve.
Add all ingredients to cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake for 15 seconds. Strain into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Garnish with candied orange peel and a cherry and serve.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice, then add tequila, Campari, lime juice, grapefruit juice, and simple syrup. Shake well and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with grapefruit twist.
Stir over ice and strain into an ice-filled brandy snifter %28or double old-fashioned glass%29. Break orange twist over the drink%2C then add as garnish.
Add all ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth. Pour unstrained into a tall glass, garnish as desired.

Pour tequila%2C elderflower liqueur%2C Chartreuse%2C and bitters into mixing glass. Fill about two-thirds full with ice cubes and stir for 40 revolutions. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon twist.
Add triple sec and cranberry juice to champagne flute. Top with cold Champagne and garnish with cranberry or orange twist. Serve immediately.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well until chilled%2C about 30 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass%3B twist lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Combine liquid ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds%3B strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist piece of orange peel over drink and use as garnish.

Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and add plenty of crushed ice. Shake well and pour%2C unstrained%2C into old fashioned glass%2C tiki mug or Hurricane glass. Garnish with orange slice and a cherry.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds; strain into chilled cocktail glass.

Combine ingredients %28except nutmeg%29 in a blender%2C and blend at high speed for no more than 5 seconds. Pour into a pilsner glass %28or other tall glass%29 and add crushed ice to fill. Dust with nutmeg%3B garnish with a cinnamon stick.
Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds%2C and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.

Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for about 20 seconds%2C then strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of lemon or orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.

Fill a mixing glass 2/3 full with ice. Add whiskey%2C dry vermouth%2C and Campari. Stir until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds%2C and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.

Combine ingredients in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for around 20 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a small piece of lemon peel over the drink and drop the twist in as garnish.
Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake well for 10 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a bit of lemon peel.
Take a beer glass %28preferably one made for Belgian beers%29 and coat the inside with absinthe. Add gin%2C and fill with beer%2C aiming for a nice%2C foamy head.

Combine vermouth%2C sherry%2C and bitters in a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir well for 20 seconds%2C then strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Pour ingredients into a mixing glass and fill with cracked ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry or a twist of orange peel.
Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir briskly for 30 seconds%2C and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a piece of orange peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Beat with a whisk%2C  hand mixer%2C  or stand mixer until stiff peaks begin to form. Set aside.

Fill two small mugs with boiling water to warm them. In a measuring cup%2C  mix averna%2C bourbon%2C creme de cacao%2C and gran classico. Stir well. When coffee is ready%2C dump hot water from mugs and divide bourbon mixture evenly between them. Add coffee and stir well. Top with whipped cream and serve immediately.

Combine heavy cream%2C  malted milk powder%2C  brown sugar%2C  and salt in a mixing bowl or bowl of a stand mixer. Beat  using the whisk attachment %2C electric beaters%2C  or a whisk  until dry ingredients are evenly incorporated and cream forms soft peaks.
Combine hot coffee%2C  spiced rum %2C and simple syrup in a prewarmed mug. Using a spoon%2C  dollop whipped cream on top of coffee and top with freshly grated nutmeg. Serve right away.
Combine in a mixing bowl or bowl of a stand mixer. Beat using the whisk attachment%2C electric beaters%2C or a whisk  until dry ingredients are evenly incorporated and cream forms soft peaks.
Combine in a prewarmed mug. Using a spoon%2C dollop whipped cream on top of coffee and top with a dusting of cocoa powder. Serve right away.

Add lemon, simple syrup, and gin to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 12 seconds. Divide between two Champagne flutes (you%27ll have about 3 ounces or 90ml per glass).
Top each glass with 3 ounces (90ml) Stiegl-Radler Grapefruit and serve immediately.

Add mint, white balsamic vinegar, Amaro Lucano, and salt to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously until well chilled, about 12 seconds. Double-strain into two Champagne flutes (you%27ll have about 1 1/2 ounces or 45ml of the mix in each glass).
Top each glass with 3 ounces (90ml) Lambrusco and serve immediately.
Add sweet vermouth, Gran Classico, and tequila to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Add a large ice cube to a rocks glass. Strain cocktail into rocks glass. Express orange twist over drink and add as garnish. Serve immediately.
Add rye whiskey, Campari, Ramazzotti, cura%C3%A7ao, and bitters to a rocks glass and add ice. Stir until well chilled, garnish with orange twist, and serve.
Add grapefruit juice, lime juice, honey, mezcal, and salt to a resealable container. Shake or stir to mix; make sure all honey is dissolved. Place in freezer for at least 4 and up to 10 hours.
When ready to serve, add mezcal mixture and ice to a blender. Blend until uniform and pour into 2 glasses. Garnish each glass with half a lime wheel, if desired, and serve immediately.
Add cucumber, lemon juice, and simple syrup to a cocktail shaker. Muddle until cucumber is broken up. Add vodka and elderflower liqueur and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Top with sparkling water and fine-strain into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish if desired and serve immediately.

%3Cstrong%3ETo Make the Ginger-Cardamom Syrup:%3C/strong%3E If using a juicer, juice ginger (yields will vary), then measure out 2 tablespoons (30ml) fresh ginger juice and mix with water. Proceed to step 2. If using an immersion blender, chop ginger roughly, then add to blender jar with water and blend thoroughly. Strain through a fine-mesh strainer; mixture should yield 4 tablespoons (60ml) ginger liquid.

In a small saucepan, combine ginger liquid and sugar. Warm over medium heat, stirring until sugar dissolves, removing from heat as soon as sugar dissolves; do not let boil. Add cardamom pods, cover, and let cool. Refrigerate at least 2 and up to 10 hours.

%3Cstrong%3ETo Make the Sangria:%3C/strong%3E Add wine, orange juice, and sweet vermouth to a pitcher. Strain Ginger-Cardamom Syrup into pitcher and stir to mix. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 2 hours.
To serve, fill wine glasses with ice. Add sangria and top with seltzer or club soda if desired. Garnish each glass with candied ginger if desired.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the lavender syrup%3C/strong%3E: Combine lavender, water, and sugar in a small saucepan. Heat over high heat until boiling, stirring to dissolve sugar. Reduce to a simmer and continue to cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain through a fine mesh strainer. Lavender syrup will keep for one week in a sealed container in the refrigerator.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the cocktail%3C/strong%3E: Fill a Collins or tall rocks glass 3/4 full of ice. Add the lavender syrup, gin and lemon juice and gently stir. Top off with Champagne or sparkling wine.
Add bourbon%2C grapefruit liqueur%2C lemon juice%2C and amaro to a cocktail shaker. Fill 2/3 full with ice and shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds.
Strain into a cocktail coupe, garnish with lemon twist, and serve immediately.
Add rum, lime juice, maple syrup, and Scotch to a cocktail shaker and fill 2/3 full with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain into a coupe glass%2C garnish with lime wheel%2C and serve immediately.
Chill a cocktail coupe.
Add rum%2C Cynar%2C Benedictine%2C Scotch%2C and bitters to a mixing glass%2C then fill with ice. Stir until well chilled%2C about 30 seconds.
Rinse chilled cocktail coupe with absinthe, discarding excess. Strain cocktail into rinsed glass and serve immediately.
Place star anise pod in a small skillet over medium heat and toast, stirring and flipping frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Transfer to a plate and set aside to cool.

Add apple brandy%2C Barolo Chinato%2C lemon juice%2C Demerara syrup%2C and orange bitters to a cocktail shaker and fill 2/3 full with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds. Fine-strain into a cocktail coupe. Garnish with toasted star anise pod.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Oleo-Saccharum%3A%3C/strong%3E In a heatproof container with at least a 36-ounce capacity%2C toss together lemon and orange zests with sugar. Muddle for 30 seconds to release the oil from the zests. Cover and let stand at room temperature for at least 8 and up to 12 hours.
