%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktails:%3C/strong%3E Pre-warm thermos by filling with water just off the boil and let stand. Meanwhile, pour rye whiskey, 8 ounces boiling water, pomegranate juice, orange cura%C3%A7ao, and bitters over the oleo-saccharum. Stir well until sugar is completely dissolved.

Discard hot water from thermos, then carefully strain rye mixture through a fine-mesh strainer into thermos (a funnel can help avoid spills); discard spent zests. Seal thermos. Optionally, when ready to drink, add new lemon zests to your cocktail, expressing the oils over the top first.

In the bottom of a mixing glass, add the superfine sugar and pomegranate seeds. Crush the seeds with a muddler to break open. Add lime wedges and muddle 6 times to release their juice. Add pomegranate juice and cacha%C3%A7a and fill glass 2/3 full with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Add sparkling wine to glass, then pour contents, without straining, into a double rocks glass. Add more fresh ice cubes if desired and serve immediately.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Smoked-Rosemary Citrus Syrup:%3C/strong%3E In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine sugar, water, and lemon and lime zest and juices. Stir to combine. Bring mixture to just under a boil, then remove from heat and cover. Meanwhile, hold rosemary over an open flame using heatproof tongs, turning continually, until it begins to smoke. As soon as it starts to smoke, uncover syrup and place rosemary in saucepan. Cover again and let steep 30 minutes. Strain solids out and reserve syrup for the punch in an airtight container. The syrup will keep for up to a month in the refrigerator, but flavors will be best if used within 2 days.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Punch:%3C/strong%3E In a punch bowl, combine gold rum, orgeat, smoked-rosemary citrus syrup, overproof rum, and water. Stir to combine and refrigerate at least 4 hours and up to overnight. To serve, add a large ice cube to the punch bowl. Ladle about 3 ounces into a punch glass and grate fresh cinnamon on top. Serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Angostura Whipped Cream%3C/strong%3E: Using an electric mixer or stand mixer fitted with the whisk, beat heavy whipping cream at high speed until soft peaks form, then add simple syrup, vanilla extract and Angostura bitters. Whip until medium peaks form, about 1 minute longer.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Hot Cocoa%3C/strong%3E: In medium saucepan, stir cocoa with sugar and salt. Stir in milk and chocolate. Heat over medium heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted and mixture is hot. Gently whisk to completely blend mixture.
Add vanilla and amaro and stir to combine. Pour into glasses and top with Angostura whipped cream.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cranberry-Black Pepper Syrup%3A%3C/strong%3E In a nonreactive saucepan%2C combine cranberries%2C peppercorns%2C apple cider vinegar%2C sugar%2C and water. Stir to combine. Cover and place over medium-high heat. Cook%2C opening the lid and stirring occasionally%2C until sugar dissolves and some of the cranberries begin popping open%2C about 10 minutes. Remove from heat%2C uncover%2C and allow to cool to room temperature%2C about 30 minutes. Pour entire mixture into an airtight%2C nonreactive container. Refrigerate at least 8 and up to 12 hours. Strain mixture twice through a fine-mesh strainer%2C transfer to an airtight container%2C and refrigerate for up to one month.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktails%3A%3C/strong%3E Slowly pour chilled sparkling wine into a pitcher. Add bitters and 12 oz of chilled cranberry-black pepper shrub. Stir very gently to mix. Serve immediately. Individual glasses can be garnished with cranberries.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Lemon-Sage Syrup%3A%3C/strong%3E Combine in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to boil%2C remove from heat%2C and let stand 1 hour. Strain and refrigerate in an airtight container up to 1 week.

In a cocktail shaker%2C muddle the rounds of ginger with lemon juice. Add the amaretto%2C bitters%2C and egg white. Shake hard to incorporate the egg white for 20 seconds%2C then fill shaker 2/3 of the way with ice and shake for an additional 20 seconds. Strain drink through a standard cocktail strainer and a fine-mesh strainer into two small aperitif glasses. Garnish each glass with a piece of candied ginger.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktails%3A%3C/strong%3E The night before serving%2C combine the lemon-sage syrup and Suze in a large pitcher. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. When ready to serve%2C add sparkling wine%2C pouring slowly%2C and gently stir to combine. Split between six Champagne flutes%2C twisting a lemon zest strip over each and garnishing with a sage leaf.

Combine tequila%2C peaches%2C pineapple chunks%2C pineapple juice%2C Suze%2C and mint leaves in a zipper-lock bag or resealable jar. Chill at least 8 hours or up to overnight in the refrigerator. Serve with extra mint and pineapple as garnish.

To serve, transfer chilled tequila mixture to a blender and add 3 cups ice. Blend at high speed until well mixed and thick, about 45 seconds. Divide between coupe glasses and garnish with a pineapple chunk and mint leaves.
Pour Scotch, blood orange juice, sweet vermouth, cherry syrup, Grand Marnier, and Angostura bitters into a resealable freezer-safe container. Seal and freeze for at least 8 and up to 24 hours.
When ready to serve%2C pour Scotch mixture into a blender with 4 cups ice. Blend until smooth. Divide between four coupe glasses and garnish each glass with an orange slice and cherry.
Combine in a large bowl. Stir to combine and let sit at room temperature overnight. Drain and rinse beans and set aside.

Place thighs in a large zipper-lock bag. In a medium bowl%2C whisk together all remaining ingredients. Pour marinade into bag with chicken%2C seal bag%2C and toss to coat well. Let chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes and up to 4 hours.

Adjust oven rack to lower middle position and preheat oven to 300 F. Place stock in a large liquid measuring cup and sprinkle gelatin over the top. Set aside. Heat duck fat in a large Dutch oven over high heat until shimmering. Add salt pork and cook%2C stirring occasionally%2C until browned all over%2C about 8 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Season with pepper %28do not add salt%29 and place skin side-down in now-empty pan. Cook without moving until well browned%2C 6 to 8 minutes. Flip chicken pieces and continue cooking until lightly browned on second side%2C about 3 minutes longer. Transfer to bowl with salt pork.
Add and cook%2C turning occasionally%2C until well-browned on both sides. Transfer to bowl with salt pork and chicken. Drain all but 2 tablespoons fat from pot.

Add onions to pot and cook, stirring and scraping up browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Cook until onions are translucent but not browned, about 4 minutes. Add drained beans, carrot, celery, garlic, parsley, bay leaves, cloves, and stock/gelatin mixture. Bring to a simmer over high heat. Reduce to low, cover Dutch oven and cook until beans are almost tender but retain a slight bite, about 45 minutes.

Using tongs, remove carrots, celery, parsley, bay leaves, and cloves and discard. Add meats to pot and stir to incorporate, making sure that the chicken pieces end up on top of the beans with the skin facing upwards. Beans should be almost completely submerged. Transfer to oven and cook, uncovered, until a thin crust forms on top, about 2 hours, adding more water by pouring it carefully down the side of the pot as necessary to keep beans mostly covered.

Break crust with a spoon and shake pot gently to redistribute. Return to oven and continue cooking%2C stopping to break and shake the crust every 30 minutes until you reach the 4 1/2 hour mark. Return to oven and continue cooking undisturbed until the crust is deep brown and thick%2C about 5 to 6 hours total. Serve.

Preheat oven to 425%C2%B0F and set oven rack to middle position. Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil and place a wire rack on top. Remove chicken from bag%2C allowing marinade to drip off%2C and set on wire rack skin side up%2C making sure to leave space between thighs. Discard marinade. Bake until thighs register 155 to 160%C2%B0F on an instant-read thermometer%2C about 35 minutes. %28Be sure to measure temperature in the center of the thickest part of the thighs%2C but not directly against the bone.%29 If chicken skin is not brown and crisp enough by the time the thighs are cooked through%2C turn on oven broiler and broil until browned and crisp%2C about 1 minute%2C being careful not to burn the skin. Transfer chicken to a platter and let rest for 5 minutes.
Garnish and serve.

In a cocktail shaker, combine strawberries, simple syrup, and lime juice and muddle until strawberries are completely dissolved. Add mint leaves and gently tap 5 times with muddler. (Do not over-muddle mint or it will taste bitter and muddy.) Add vodka to shaker and fill 2/3 full with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Fill a Collins glass with ice and add club soda. Fine-strain cocktail into glass and stir gently. Garnish with lime, mint, or strawberry, if desired.

Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Add mezcal, Aperol, lemon juice, and bitters. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Fill a rocks glass with fresh ice. Add club soda to glass and strain cocktail on top. Garnish with lemon peel.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Pineapple Shrub%3A%3C/strong%3E Place the pineapple cubes in a clean%2C sterilized wide-mouth container. Cover with sugar and lightly crush the pineapples using a potato masher or muddler. Cover and refrigerate 10 hours. Strain fruit %28discard or save for another use%29 and add apple cider vinegar to the liquid. Seal with lid and refrigerate for two weeks%2C shaking the mixture every other day. After two weeks%2C strain into a clean airtight container%3B you%27ll have about 3 cups. Refrigerate up to 6 months.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktails%3A%3C/strong%3E In a pitcher%2C mix together white rum%2C Pineapple Shrub%2C and orgeat. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving%2C or mix and refrigerate up to 24 hours in advance. When ready to serve%2C add beer to the pitcher and stir gently. Serve cocktails in ice-filled highball glasses.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Grapefruit Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Combine grapefruit zest, juice, and sugar in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat, cover and let stand for 1 hour. Strain into an air-tight container. Refrigerate until ready to use or up to 1 week.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Bottled Cocktails:%3C/strong%3E In the bottom of a mixing glass, muddle together thyme and salt. Add lime juice and stir. Fine-strain into a 24-ounce carafe or swing-top bottle and then pour in grapefruit syrup and pisco. Cap and gently shake to combine. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour.
For each cocktail, add one large ice cube to a double rocks glass. Pour in 2 3/4 ounces of the bottled cocktail. Gently stir and garnish with a sprig of thyme.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Lemongrass Infused Vodka%3A%3C/strong%3E Remove tough outer layer from each lemongrass stalk. Chop stalks into 1-inch pieces and bruise them by crushing them with the blunt side of a heavy knife. For slow infusion%2C add lemongrass pieces to an airtight container and cover with vodka. Seal and let stand at room temperature for 1 week%2C shaking daily. Taste after 1 week and continue to steep up to 2 weeks to desired flavor. Strain into an airtight container.

Alternatively, to infuse instantly using a siphon, take lemongrass pieces and add to whipped cream canister. Pour in vodka and seal. Charge with one N2O charger. Shake well. Charge a second time with a second N2O charger. Shake well and then discharge contents through a strainer into a clean, airtight container. Infused vodka keeps at room temperature for up to 6 months.

%3Cstrong%3EFor Each Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E In a cocktail shaker, add Lemongrass Infused Vodka, lime juice, simple syrup, and egg white. Shake without ice for 30 seconds to incorporate the egg white. Fill cocktail shaker with ice, then shake hard until well chilled, about 30 seconds. Double strain into cocktail glass and garnish with lemon bitters and lime zest.
Combine whiskey, Averna, lemon juice, and syrup together in a shaker filled 2/3 with ice. Shake until thoroughly chilled, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with cherry and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Orange Ginger Simple Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Combine the orange zest, grated ginger, sugar, and water in a small saucepan over high heat. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 7 minutes. Let cool to room temperature then strain through a fine mesh strainer and discard solids. Refrigerate in a sealed container until ready to use, up to 1 week.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Spiced Cranberry Mixer:%3C/strong%3E In a pitcher or quart jar, stir together the orange ginger syrup, cranberry juice, and rum. Refrigerate until ready to use, up to 1 week after you%27ve made the orange ginger syrup.
%3Cstrong%3EFor each cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Pour spiced cranberry mixer into a coupe glass and top with sparkling wine. Stir once and garnish with a few thinly sliced fresh cranberries.

Add brown sugar to a rocks glass. Pour lemon juice over the brown sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Pour in Carpano Antica and apple cider then fill with ice. Stir gently to combine and then top with club soda. Garnish with lemon peel and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Spiced Cider Concentrate:%3C/strong%3E In a medium saucepan, combine cider, cinnamon, allspice, cloves and black pepper. Bring to a boil then reduce heat to a simmer. Keep at a simmer, uncovered, until reduced by 3/4, and consistency is viscous like maple syrup, about 2 hours. Strain and let cool to room temperature. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a month.
In a mixing glass, saturate the sugar cubes with the bitters and muddle to break down the sugar cubes. Add ice and rye.
Stir until well chilled and the sugar is almost completely dissolved.
Put a dash of absinthe in each of the two serving glasses and swirl it around to coat the glass, discarding any extra. Fill the glasses with ice.
Strain the chilled rye mixture evenly between the two serving glasses and top each one with two ounces cider. Garnish with lemon peel if desired and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Combine apple brandy, spiced cider concentrate, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled highball glass. Top with hard cider. Garnish with apple slice or apple chip if desired. Serve
Add Cynar, Montenegro, and lime juice to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 12 seconds. Add ginger beer.
Strain into an ice-filled Collins glass, garnish with lime wheels if desired, and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the charred lemon juice:%3C/strong%3E Preheat a well seasoned cast iron or stainless steel skillet over high heat. Add lemon halves cut side down and cook until well charred, about about 2 minutes. Let cool then juice, straining out seeds.

%3Cstrong%3EFor gin rosemary mixer:%3C/strong%3E In a pitcher or quart jar, combine the rosemary and sugar, bruising it with the back of a wooden spoon until you can smell the rosemary. Add the gin and lemon juice and stir to dissolve the sugar. Refrigerate, removing the rosemary sprigs after one hour.

%3Cstrong%3EFor each cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Fill a glass with ice. Pour in gin rosemary mixer through a fine-mesh strainer. Top with sparkling wine. Stir once. Garnish with a sprig of fresh rosemary and serve.

Combine sherry, cranberry juice, rum, simple syrup, and bitters in a cocktail shaker. Fill 2/3 full with ice and shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail coupe. Garnish with orange peel.
Add Suze and elderflower liqueur to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds. Strain into a Champagne flute and top with Cava. Garnish with lemon twist.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the raspberry mint syrup:%3C/strong%3E In a medium saucepan, combine raspberries, sugar, and water over medium-high heat. Mash raspberries with a wooden spoon to break up. Bring to a boil and then remove from heat. Add mint leaves and stir to combine. Cover and let stand for 30 minutes. Using a fine-mesh strainer, strain into an airtight container. Syrup keeps up to 1 month in the refrigerator.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Fill a rocks glass or goblet with ice. Add sparkling wine, club soda, Cocchi Americano, and Raspberry-Mint Syrup. Gently stir to combine. Garnish with raspberries and a sprig of mint.

%3Cstrong%3EFor Smoked Ice%3A%3C/strong%3E Place ice cubes in baking dish or pie plate. Following instructions of your smoker%2C heat wood chips until smoking. Set dish of ice in smoker%2C cover%2C and smoke until ice has melted%2C 10 to 20 minutes. Alternatively%2C line bottom of roasting pan with aluminum foil and arrange 1/2 cup wood chips on one side of pan. Using a butane torch or long-reach lighter%2C carefully burn wood chips until smoking but not in flames. Carefully set rack in roasting pan%2C set dish of ice on rack opposite the wood chips%2C cover%2C and smoke until ice has melted%2C 10 to 20 minutes. Pour smoked water into ice-cube tray and freeze.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Add both rums, pineapple juice, lime juice, simple syrup, and bitters to a cocktail shaker and fill 2/3 full with non-smoked ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Add smoked ice cubes to a double rocks glass, and strain cocktail into glass. Garnish with a cherry, pineapple chunk, and mint sprig. Serve immediately.
Add Old Tom gin, lemon, grenadine, and simple syrup to cocktail shaker and fill 2/3 full with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Add seltzer to shaker and stir very gently to mix.
Fill a julep cup or rocks glass with cracked ice. Strain cocktail into cup. Garnish with mint and berries and serve immediately.

In the bottom of a pitcher, gently muddle together the mint leaves and simple syrup. Add grapefruit chunks, grapefruit juice, and Lillet Ros%C3%A9. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or up to overnight.
When ready to serve, add Cava to the pitcher and stir gently. Serve over ice.
Fill a Collins glass with ice. Add mezcal and top with soda. Stir gently to combine. Serve.

Add the mint leaves and Velvet Falernum to a shaker, muddle gently until mint is fragrant but not pulverized. Add tequila, lime juice, and Cynar, then fill shaker 2/3 full with ice. Shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker begins to frost.
Double strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with ginger beer, garnish with mint sprig, and serve.
Add strawberries, bell pepper, and pomegranate molasses to a shaker and muddle until strawberry is broken down.
Add tequila and lime juice, then fill shaker 2/3 full with ice and shake vigorously until the outside of the shaker begins to frost.
Double strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with extra strawberry slice and serve.
Rinse a rocks glass with absinthe, pour out remainder, then fill with ice. Add tequila, creme de cacao, and Angostura bitters. Stir gently. Garnish with orange twist and serve.
Add the mezcal%2C Cynar%2C sherry%2C and bitters to a rocks glass. Then add a large cube of ice.
Give a gentle stir (about 5 seconds), then garnish with a grapefruit twist, drop a pinch of salt on top of the ice and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cranberry syrup:%3C/strong%3E Add cranberry juice to medium sauce pan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Allow the juice to reduce by half. Remove from the heat and then add sugar. Stir to dissolve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor each drink:%3C/strong%3E Add basil leaves and agave nectar to the bottom of a julep cup then muddle gently. Add mezcal and cranberry syrup, add the straw, then top with crushed ice. Drizzle extra 1/4 ounce cranberry syrup on top, garnish with basil leaves, then serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Ginger Juice:%3C/strong%3E Slice ginger into chunks and place in bottom of mixing glass. Muddle until broken up well, about 1 minute. Strain juice through fine-mesh strainer, pressing on solids with the back of a spoon to extract juice.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Ginger Juice:%3C/strong%3E Slice ginger into chunks and place in bottom of mixing glass. Muddle until broken up well, about 1 minute. Strain juice through fine-mesh strainer, pressing on solids with the back of a spoon to extract juice.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E In a cocktail shaker, muddle mango, cilantro, lemon juice, ginger juice, and simple syrup until the mango is completely dissolved.

Fill shaker with 2/3 full with ice and add tequila. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Using a strainer, pour into a serving glass filled with ice. Garnish with additional cilantro if desired.

In a cocktail shaker, muddle strawberries, simple syrup, lime juice, and balsamic syrup until strawberries are completely dissolved. Add mint leaves and gently tap 5 times with muddler. (Do not over-muddle mint or it will taste bitter and muddy.) Add tequila to shaker and fill 2/3 full with ice.
Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Using a strainer, pour into a serving glass filled with ice. Garnish with additional mint or strawberry if desired.
Add gin and citrus juices to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain into ice-filled glass%2C add salt on top and serve.
Fill a mixing glass 2/3 full with ice. Add gin, Campari, sweet vermouth, and absinthe. Stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist and serve.
Fill a highball glass with ice. Add Campari, sweet vermouth and absinthe. Stir to mix, about 10 seconds.
Top with club soda and Prosecco. Stir gently and garnish with orange twist.
Whip cream in a bowl with a whisk until it reaches a thick consistency, but is still fluid enough to pour, about 45 seconds.
Top drink with whipped cream by floating it over the back of a bar spoon. Garnish with a pinch of brown sugar on top if desired.

Add kiwi and tarragon leaves to mixing glass and muddle until kiwi is liquified%2C about 30 seconds. Add gin%2C lime%2C and simple syrup. Fill mixing glass with ice and shake until well chilled%2C about 30 seconds. Strain into ice-filled glass%2C top with seltzer and stir gently.
Garnish and serve.

Lightly muddle mint leaves in the bottom of a mixing glass. Add cold brew coffee, rum, sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, and bitters and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds.
Strain into a tall glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with mint sprig and serve.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass. Fill with ice and stir until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds.
Add gin, tea, honey simple syrup, and orange bitters to a cocktail shaker and fill 2/3 full with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into coupe glass and serve.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist and olive, then serve.
Heat serving glass by running under hot water and wiping dry. Pour the mixture into the glass and add hot coffee.
Garnish and serve.
Add the cucumber slices to the bottom of a mixing glass. Muddle them to break up, but do not pulverize completely.
Add gin and Aperol to mixing glass then fill 2/3 with ice and stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, garnish with lemon twist and serve.

Add gin, lemon, simple syrup, rosewater, and eggwhite to a cocktail shaker. Dry shake (without ice) to incorporate eggwhite, about 30 seconds. Fill shaker with ice and shake until frothy, about 30 seconds longer.
Double strain by pouring through a bar strainer into a fine-mesh or conical strainer set in a highball glass filled with ice. Top drink with club soda and bitters. Gently stir and serve.
Combine agave nectar and hot water in a mug or serving glass, stir until dissolved. Add mezcal, Chartreuse, ginger beer, mole bitters, and Angostura bitters. Stir and add cinnamon stick.
Press lime zest and mint between your hands. Drop into toddy and serve.
Stir liquid ingredients in a cocktail shaker for 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist and serve.
Fill a mixing glass 2/3 full with ice. Add bourbon, Fernet Branca and simple syrup. Stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds.
Strain cocktail into an ice-filled rocks glass. Garnish with orange twist and pineapple chunk on a pick, serve immediately.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange twist and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the syrup:%3C/strong%3E in a small sauce pan over high heat, add water, honey, cinnamon and bring to a simmer, stirring to dissolve. Remove from heat, cover, and let stand for 30 minutes. Strain into an airtight container. Will keep for about one month refrigerated.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail:%3C/strong%3E fill a mixing glass 2/3 full with ice and add Cynar, rum, syrup, and lime juice. Stir for about 20 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail coupe.
Crack egg into cocktail shaker. Add sherry, rum, bitters, and demerara syrup. Dry shake to emulsify egg, about 15 seconds.
Add ice to cocktail shaker and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into cocktail glass. Grate cinnamon stick on top of drink and serve.
Scatter Maldon salt on a small plate. Rub the rim of two heatproof glasses or mugs with the lemon half, then dip in salt.

Combine the butter, maple syrup, and vanilla bean seeds in small bowl. Set aside. Combine rum and cider in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Pour into prepared glasses, then top each with half of the butter. Serve immediately.

Bring cider and bourbon to a simmer in small saucepan. Stir in ginger liqueur and add lemon juice to taste. Divide cherries between 2 heatproof glasses or mugs and pour in cider combination. Sprinkle with pepper and serve immediately.
Combine Benedictine and cider in a Champagne flute or coupe. Top with Prosecco. Garnish with rosemary or thyme, if desired.
Combine Campari, vermouth, rum, and Fernet Branca in a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain into a rocks glass over a large piece of ice. Garnish with fresh mint.
Reserve two sage leaves for garnish and muddle the rest gently in a cocktail shaker.
Fill the shaker with ice. Add bourbon, pumpkin butter, lemon juice, and bitters. Shake until well-chilled, about 20 seconds.
Strain evenly into two coupe glasses and float a sage leaf on top of each drink.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Shrub Syrup%3C/strong%3E%3A Combine in a quart jar. Shake to combine and refrigerate for 72 hours%2C shaking once a day to help dissolve the sugar.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Concord Grape Puree%3C/strong%3E%3A Puree the grapes on medium until only small pieces of skin remain. Strain through a fine mesh sieve%2C pressing and stirring the solids to extract as much liquid as possible. Discard the solids%2C stir the lemon juice into the the resulting liquid%2C and refrigerate if not using immediately.
Strain the mixture through a fine mesh sieve, pressing the solids to extract as much of the syrupy liquid as possible. Discard solids and add the vinegar to the syrup. Refrigerate until ready to use.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Hot Pink Cocktail%3C/strong%3E: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add shrub syrup and gin. Shake until well-chilled, about 20 seconds.
Strain into an ice-filled highball glass, top with seltzer, stir to combine and serve.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the dark rum, light rum, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, and simple syrup. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds.
Divide evenly between two ice-filled highball glasses. Top each glass with two ounces cider, stir gently to combine, garnish with grapefruit peel if desired, and serve.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add beet juice%2C Scotch%2C lemon juice%2C and ginger liqueur. Shake until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain evenly into two coupe glasses and serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Concord Grape Syrup%3C/strong%3E: Pulse the grapes a few times on low speed in a blender then puree on low for a few seconds, until the grape skins are chopped and the grape flesh is slightly broken down. Combine the rough grape puree with the water and sugar in a small saucepan. Cook over very low heat for 15 minutes, stirring frequently. The mixture should only simmer for the last 3 minutes of its cooking time. Remove from heat, strain through a fine mesh sieve, gently pressing the solids to extract the liquid. Refrigerate until completely cool.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail%3C/strong%3E: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add the Scotch, sherry, grape syrup, lemon juice, and bitters. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into a coupe glass and garnish with lemon peel if desired.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail%3C/strong%3E: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add bourbon, Concord grape puree, Cardamaro, and simple syrup. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled old fashioned glass.
Combine tequila, Campari, grapefruit juice, lime juice, and simple syrup in a serving pitcher. Add 2 cups ice and stir for 15 seconds. Add ginger beer and stir gently.
Divide cocktail between 6 glasses and garnish with lime wheel.
Combine the cherries%2C sugar%2C and lemon juice in a large pitcher. Stir to combine and let sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes for the cherries to release some of their juices.
Add red wine and Cherry Heering to the pitcher and refrigerate 2 hours or up to overnight.
Stir in cold seltzer and the lemon wheels and serve immediately.
Muddle pineapple and 5 basil leaves in cocktail shaker until you%27ve made a pulpy puree. Fill the cocktail shaker with ice, add rye and kale juice. Shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds.
Place remaining 3 basil leaves in an old fashioned glass. Fill glass with ice, strain cocktail into glass, and garnish with basil sprig and pineapple slice. Serve immediately.
Combine aged rum and 151 rum, coffee liqueur, molasses, bitters, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker. Fill shaker with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into ice-filled glass.
Top with soda water and lightly stir to combine.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Slushy Base%3A%3C/strong%3E In a large bowl whisk ingredients until very well combined. Transfer to freezer and chill until very cold%2C about 1 1/2 hours.

Transfer chilled base into ice cream maker and churn until base looks like a soft sorbet without visible liquid pooling at the top. A spoon pressed against the base should leave a clear indentation once removed. Transfer churned base to an airtight container and chill in freezer until ready to serve.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Red Wine Syrup:%3C/strong%3E In a small saucepan, whisk together wine and sugar over high heat. Once all sugar is dissolved, let wine boil until it reduces in volume by half, bubbles begin to stack on each other, and the syrup reads 222°F on a candy thermometer. Transfer to a small container and chill in refrigerator until ready to serve.

%3Cstrong%3ETo Assemble:%3C/strong%3E Spoon 1 to 2 tablespoons of wine syrup in the bottom of each bowl or cup. Scoop about 1/2 cup slushie base into a small work bowl, then stir in additional whiskey to each person%27s taste. Slushy base will remain semi-solid even with a generous amount of added alcohol. Serve with a spoon or a thick straw.
Combine the honey and warm water in the bottom of a cocktail shaker and stir vigorously until completely combined.
Add to cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds. Strain into two coupe glasses and serve immediately.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the jalape%C3%B1o-infused tequila:%3C/strong%3E Scrape membranes and seeds from jalape%C3%B1o peppers, discarding green exterior. Add seeds and membranes to a large mason jar and top with tequila. Let tequila infuse for 9 minutes, then taste for spice level and let steep up to 6 minutes more. Steeping time will depend on the heat of your peppers. Strain to remove pepper seeds and membranes and reseal.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the rich sugar syrup:%3C/strong%3E Mix hot water into sugar and stir until sugar dissolves. Let cool before using.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Combine spicy tequila, cane syrup, celery juice and lime juice in a cocktail shaker. Fill shaker with ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into coupe glass and serve with a pinch of smoked salt on top.

Combine tequila%2C lime juice%2C triple sec%2C and Pimm%27s in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 20 seconds. Strain contents into a Collins glass filled with ice and top with ginger ale.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Honey Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Stir together hot water and honey until honey dissolves.

%3Cstrong%3EFor Each Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Add whiskey, lemon, sweet vermouth, and honey syrup to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled Collins glass. Top with seltzer and garnish with a lemon twist.
Add Orchard Apricot, Cocchi Americano, and gin to mixing glass. Fill with ice and stir until well chilled, about 20 seconds.
Rinse coupe glass with absinthe and dump out (or use 2 sprays of a spray bottle). Strain drink into absinthe-rinsed glass and garnish with lemon twist. Serve immediately.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the honey syrup:%3C/strong%3E stir hot water into honey until honey is dissolved. Let cool.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail%3C/strong%3E Add Scotch, lemon juice, allspice dram, and honey syrup to a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Add one large ice cube to a rocks glass. Strain cocktail into glass, top with Cherry Heering, and serve.
Combine gin, grapefruit juice, lemon juice, and elderflower liqueur in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain into cocktail glass, garnish with basil leaf, and serve immediately.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Pineapple Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Combine pineapple chunks, sugar, and water in a medium saucepan on medium heat. Stir to combine and let simmer until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Cover and allow to infuse in the refrigerator at least 5 hours or overnight. Strain syrup through a fine mesh strainer and discard solids. Syrup will keep in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E In a tall glass filled with crushed ice combine tequila, coconut water, lime juice, and pineapple syrup. Swizzle together with a swizzle stick by rotating it between your hands as if you were rubbing your hands to get warm. (If you don%27t have a swizzle stick, stir with a barspoon.) Float Green Chartreuse on top, garnish with lime wheel, and serve.

Break up the fennel seeds using a mortar and pestle or under a heavy skillet. Cook the honey, water, fennel, and rosemary over medium heat stirring frequently, until it is integrated into a syrup, about 5 minutes. Let cool, with the fennel  and rosemary still in the pot. Scrape off any white foam.

Once the syrup has cooled, pour liquid (with the fennel and rosemary still in it) into a sealable glass jar. Add Scotch, seal, and shake. Steep for 3 days at room temperature. Strain. Liqueur can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 6 months.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the vanilla syrup:%3C/strong%3E Split and scoop the vanilla bean pod lengthwise. Bring water to a boil, add sugar and vanilla bean. Stir well, reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Let cool completely, then strain out solids and keep sealed up to 1 week.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail:%3C/strong%3E combine the gin, aquavit, vanilla syrup, lime juice, Galliano, and absinthe in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake 15 seconds, until well chilled. Strain into a coupe glass and serve.

Remove lemon peel using a vegetable peeler, trying to get as little of the white pith as possible. Quarter lemon and squeeze juice from 2 of the quarters into a glass or measuring cup to yield about 3/4 of an ounce. Reserve remaining quarters.

Bring water to a simmer. Add cloves, star anise, cinnamon sticks, and nutmeg to water to make an infusion. Reduce heat to a bare simmer and cook for 10 minutes. Add red wine, port, sugar, orange quarters, reserved lemon quarters, lemon juice, and lemon peel. Let simmer for another 10 minutes.
Remove from heat and strain out spices and citrus. Return to very low heat and keep warm.
Pour 1 ounce of rum into each serving mug, top with hot mulled wine. Garnish each glass with cinnamon slick and lemon wheel.
Pierce orange with cloves. Holding the orange with a fork, torch the cloves with a brul%C3%A9e torch until fragrant.
Combine all three rums, lemon juice, demerara syrup, and allspice in punchbowl. Add clove-pierced orange. Let sit for 20 minutes before serving, then serve in ice-filled punch glasses.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Ginger Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Slice ginger into chunks and place in bottom of mixing glass. Muddle until broken up well. Strain juice through fine-mesh tea strainer, pressing on solids to extract juice. Measure out 1/2 ounce fresh ginger juice, pour into small glass, mix with sugar until dissolved, stirring well. Mixture will be very thick.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Pour rye, 3/4 ounce ginger syrup and lime juice into a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into coupe, garnish as desired and serve.

Muddle rosemary in a cocktail shaker. Add tequila%2C St. Germain%2C lemon%2C and bitters to cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds. Strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Top with Moscato d%27Asti and garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

To make rosemary simple syrup, combine water and sugar in a saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and add rosemary sprigs. Let steep for 25 minutes. Discard rosemary and let cool.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add calvados, rum, lemon juice, and rosemary simple syrup. Stir until chilled, about 10 seconds. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Fill halfway to top with ginger beer%2C then to the top with cava. Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the molasses syrup:%3C/strong%3E Stir molasses and hot water in a resealable jar until dissolved. Let cool before using. Molasses syrup can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Add rum, 1/2 ounce molasses syrup, ginger liqueur, bitters, and egg white to a shaker. Shake without ice for 10 seconds to break up egg white. Add ice to shaker and shake again until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Double strain into chilled coupe glass. Grate cinnamon on top and serve.
Pour balsamic vinegar into small saucepan, bring to a boil. Let simmer until reduced by half, about 10 minutes. Let cool to room temperature.

To make cocktail, pour rye, lemon, simple syrup, and 1 barspoon of balsamic reduction into a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into and ice-filled rocks glass.

Pour grapefruit juice%2C rye%2C lemon juice%2C and simple syrup in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice and shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice. Top with Lillet Rouge  and add 2 dashes grapefruit bitters. Serve.
Combine in a cocktail shaker. Fill with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds.
Strain into ice-filled glass. Garnish with lime twist.
Combine in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Spiced Simple Syrup%3A%3C/strong%3E Combine in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium heat%2C stirring frequently. Cook until sugar has melted%2C remove from heat%2C and allow to cool to room temperature before straining. Syrup can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
Strain into ice-filled serving glass, grate nutmeg liberally over the top and serve.
Place sugar cube in a cocktail glass. Add bitters and elderflower liqueur. Top with sparkling wine and garnish with orchid if desired.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cardamom Syrup%3C/strong%3E: Pulse cardamom pods in a spice grinder or small food processor until broken into large chunks. Combine water and cardamom in a small pot and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and let cardamom steep for 15 minutes. Add sugar and stir until completely dissolved. Allow to cool before using. For best results, keep cardamom pods in syrup overnight, then strain before using. Syrup will keep in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
Combine scotch, lemon juice, and syrup in a large punch bowl or pitcher. Chill in refrigerator. Serve each cup of punch over ice and top with soda water.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cinnamon Batter:%3C/strong%3E In a small bowl mash together butter, brown sugar, and ground cinnamon, and mix until all the ingredients are evenly incorporated.

Divide batter between 4 mugs%3B pour 1 1/2 ounces of rum into each mug%2C followed by 1.5 teaspoons of spiced simple syrup. Pour 6 ounces boiling water in each mug and stir until batter is dissolved. Serve hot garnished with cinnamon sticks.
Combine bourbon, Galliano, lemon juice, maple syrup, and mint leaves in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake lightly for about 5 seconds, or flip shaker back and forth for a light shake.
Fill rocks glass with crushed ice and strain cocktail carefully into glass. Add one or two small straws. Clap the mint sprig lightly between hands to release essential oils, garnish with mint sprig.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cola Syrup%3A%3C/strong%3E Combine in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat%2C reduce to a light simmer%2C cover and cook for 20 minutes. Remove from heat.
Garnish with orange twist and serve.
Add to saucepan. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Strain through a fine mesh strainer lined with cheesecloth and let cool. Store syrup in refrigerator for up to 4 weeks until ready to use.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the Cocktail%3A%3C/strong%3E Pour Old Tom gin%2C rum%2C tequila%2C triple sec%2C lemon juice%2C lime juice%2C cola syrup%2C and bitters into a carbonating cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake%2C carbonate%2C and strain into an ice filled Collins glass. Garnish with lemon and lime wheels.
Combine and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer and cook until cranberries start to burst%2C 10 to 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.

Use the immersion blender to roughly break up the cranberries just enough so that the juice is release yet the mixture remains chunky. Pour into a sealable glass jar along with the vodka and shake. Let steep at room temperature for 2 days%2C then sample and continue to steep until you%27re happy with the flavor.
Strain through a sieve lined with cheesecloth, pressing down to extract as much liquid as possible. Store at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 6 months.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the ginger-agave syrup%3C/strong%3E: In a resealable jar, stir ginger juice into agave nectar until loosened. Cover and shake well. Store for up to 1 week, shake before using. Recipe makes enough syrup for four cocktails.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail%3C/strong%3E: Combine lemon juice, ginger-agave syrup, and tequila in a cocktail shaker. Fill shaker with ice and shake until well chilled, about 15 seconds.
Strain into a double rocks glass over a large ice cube. Top with mezcal and serve.

Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add rye, Cynar, and sweet vermouth, and stir until very cold, about 15 seconds. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a brandied cherry in the bottom of the glass.
Chill an old-fashioned glass and rinse with pear liqueur, discarding any left in the bottom.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice and add Scotch%2C sherry%2C walnut liqueur%2C and bitters. Stir for until very cold%2C about 15 seconds%2C then strain into pear-rinsed glass.
Curl orange twist over the drink to express oils, rub it zest-side down around the rim of the glass, and then discard twist and serve cocktail.
Add to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds.
Garnish and serve.
Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Fill a cocktail shaker and four glasses with ice. Add 3 ounces rum, 1 ounce Campari, 4 ounces blood orange juice, and 1 ounce lemon juice to shaker.
Shake until evenly chilled then divide between 2 glasses. Repeat and fill the second two glasses. Top each glass with soda water and garnish with orange.

Fill stirring glass generously with ice. Add rum%2C bourbon%2C vermouth%2C Angostura and orange bitters to glass. Stir gently until well chilled%2C about 1 minute. Pour through julep strainer into glass.
Combine in shaker with a small handful of pebble-sized pieces of cracked ice. Shake until fully chilled and diluted %28about 15 seconds%29.
Strain into iced filled Collins glass, top with club soda and three dashes Peychaud%27s bitters, serve.
Add to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled cocktail glass and serve.
Muddle lightly in a cocktail shaker.
Add applejack and honey liqueur, fill with ice. Shake vigorously for 15 seconds. Strain into a rocks glass, garnish with mint, and serve.
Add to a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake until well chilled%2C about 15 seconds.
Place a large ice cube in an old fashioned glass. Add bourbon%2C maraschino%2C orange bitters%2C and Angostura and stir until chilled%2C about 15 seconds.
Strain into a chilled coupe and garnish with mint sprig.

Combine and cook over medium heat stirring frequently%2C until it is integrated into a syrup%2C about 5 minutes. Let cool%2C with the orange zest and cinnamon still in the pot. Scrape off any white foam.

Once the syrup has cooled, remove the zest and cinnamon. Then combine the honey syrup and vodka in a sealable glass jar, seal, and shake. Serve immediately, or for better flavor, allow to rest for a minimum of 12 hours. Store at room temperature or in the refrigerator for up to 6 months.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the strawberry syrup:%3C/strong%3E Place the strawberries and simple syrup in a sealable container. Let sit overnight in refrigerator. Crush berries lightly into syrup, then strain.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Combine 5 ounces strawberry syrup, gin, Campari, lime juice, and 1 quart ice in the jar of a blender. Blend until ice is completely broken up and the mixture is smooth.
Divide mixture between 4 serving glasses. Garnish each glass with a basil leaf.
Combine in a cocktail shaker.
Fill shaker with ice and shake until well chilled, about 20 seconds. Strain into chilled rocks glass. Garnish with a wedge of grapefruit.

Slice peach in quarters and place in cocktail shaker. Add lime juice and sugar, muddle well. Add cacha%C3%A7a and lime wedges, fill shaker with ice and shake until very cold, about 15 seconds. Pour unstrained into a rocks glass.
Add to the jar of a blender. Blend until ice is completely broken up and the mixture is smooth.
Divide between 4 serving glasses. Garnish each glass with pineapple fronds.

%3Cstrong%3EFor Rooibos Tea Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Pour boiling water over tea bags and let steep 5 minutes. Remove tea bags. Stir in sugar to dissolve. Let cool before using. Syrup can be stored in refrigerator for up to 1 week.
In a mixing glass%2C muddle peach slices%2C rooibos syrup%2C and lemon juice into a rough pulp. Add cognac and Lillet blanc%2C stir to mix. Pour unstrained into serving glass.
Fill serving glass with crushed ice, garnish with large bunch of mint.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Basil Syrup:%3C/strong%3E Combine water, sugar, and basil leaves in a small saucepan. Heat over high heat until boiling, stirring to dissolve sugar. Reduce to a simmer and continue to cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain through a fine mesh strainer. Basil syrup will keep for one week in a sealed container in the refrigerator.

%3Cstrong%3EFor the Cocktail:%3C/strong%3E Combine 1 ounce basil syrup, lime juice, and vodka in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Fill a collins glass with ice, then strain the cocktail into the glass. Add extra basil leaves to the glass, top with seltzer and stir gently. Garnish with straw and basil sprig.
In a cocktail shaker, muddle nectarine half. Add rum, lime, Cynar, and peach liqueur, then fill shaker with ice. Shake until very cold, about 10 seconds. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

Rinse the drinking glass with absinthe and dispose of excess. Combine sherry, gin, simple syrup, and orange cream citrate in a mixing glass. Add ice and stir until chilled. Strain into drinking glass. Squeeze lemon twist over the cocktail to express its oils and then drop into the glass. Serve.
Mix and stir%2C mashing pineapple lightly. Let sit at room temperature 2 hours%2C or cover and refrigerate overnight to infuse.

Transfer pineapple/sugar mixture to a large pitcher or punch bowl. Add rum and lemon and stir well. Add sparkling water, stir gently, then divide among ice-filled serving glasses. Serve, garnished with lemon wedges.

Muddle raspberries in a mixing glass. Add ice, rum, lemon juice, and agave syrup. Shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Strain into an ice-filled Collins glass and top off with ginger beer. Stir gently before serving.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add lime juice, rum, and Campari. Shake well.
Strain into ice-filled rocks glass. Add grapefruit soda, stir gently and serve.
Add to a cocktail shaker. Shake for 15 seconds. Strain into cocktail glass and serve immediately.
In a large pitcher%2C stir lime juice%2C rum%2C orange cura%C3%A7ao%2C and Angostura bitters. At this point%2C punch can be covered and refrigerated for up to 4 hours.
When ready to serve, add ice and ginger beer to punch mixture and stir gently. Serve in ice-filled glasses, garnished with orange slices.

%3Cstrong%3ETo Make the Ginger Syrup%3A%3C/strong%3E Grind the ginger until fine in a food processor and press it through a fine mesh strainer. Measure and combine equal parts ginger juice and granulated sugar %28by volume%29 in a jar.  Seal and shake until the sugar is completely dissolved. Unused ginger syrup can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

%3Cstrong%3ETo make the cocktail%3C/strong%3E Shake gin%2C bourbon%2C ginger syrup%2C simple syrup%2C lime juice%2C and a dash of bitters in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain the cocktail into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice cubes and top the glass with soda. Garnish with cucumber and candied ginger on a toothpick and a sprig of mint. Serve with a straw.
Combine in a shaker and shake vigorously for 15 seconds with no ice. Add ice to shaker and continue shaking vigorously for 20 seconds.
Take the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder, and salt for a spin in your food processor, then move them to a large mixing bowl.
Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a chilled coupe glass.  Grate some fresh nutmeg onto the surface of the drink and serve.
Strain the mixture through a fine mesh strainer into a chilled coupe glass.  Grate some fresh nutmeg onto the surface of the drink and serve.
Muddle in a cocktail shaker until the cucumber has completely dissolved.
Crank the oven to 325%C2%B0F.

Fill the cocktail shaker with ice, add the gin and shake for about 10 seconds. Pour the cocktail through a mini strainer into a collins glass filled with ice. Top with seltzer water and garnish with a cucumber slice.

Spin the sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla in the processor, pulsing just a few times to bring everything together. Dump the goo right on top of the dry team and stir to combine. (Don%27t worry if there are a few lumps).

Install the processor%27s shredding blade and shred the pumpkin in the food processor. Dump onto a kitchen towel and twist into a ball to wring out as much water as possible (within reason) - oh, and do this over the sink. Fold the pumpkin and the pumpkin seeds into the batter using a large rubber spatula, or, better yet, your hand.

Pour into a nonstick 9-by-5-by-3-inch loaf pan or a standard nonstick muffin pan, filling the latter two thirds full. (If your only loaf pan is not nonstick - i.e., it%27s a %22stick%22 pan - lightly butter it and dust with flour. )

Bake the loaf for 1 hour and 15 minutes to 1 1/2 hours, or until an internal temperature of 200%C2%B0 to 210%C2%B0F is reached. Cool for 15 minutes in the pan, then turn out onto a cooling rack. Cool completely. If making muffins, bake them for 30 minutes, and remove from the muffin tin to a cooling rack immediately.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the topping%3A %3C/strong%3ECombine in a small bowl then work in the butter%2C using a fork to combine. Keep %22forking%22 until the mixture has a crumb-like texture. Set aside.
%3Cstrong%3EFor the cake%3A %3C/strong%3EHeat the oven to 375 degrees F. Spray a 9-inch square baking dish with nonstick cooking spray and set aside.
Whisk together in a medium bowl and set aside.
Use a blender or food processor to finely puree the melon. Add the Campari, lime zest, lime juice, sugar and salt and process another 30 seconds

Beat together the butter and sugar in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium speed until light and fluffy, approximately 1 minute. Reduce the speed a bit and thoroughly incorporate the egg. Reduce the speed to low (or %22stir%22 on a Kitchenaid) and add one-third of the flour mixture. Once incorporated, add one-third of the milk then repeat alternating until all ingredients are combined.
Gently stir in the blueberries and pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and sprinkle on the topping mixture.
Bake on the middle rack of the oven for 45 minutes, or until golden. Cool for 30 minutes before serving.
Move to an airtight container and chill 1 hour.
Churn according to your ice cream maker%27s instructions then return to the airtight container to harden in freezer 3 to 4 hours before serving.
Serve a scoop in a glass of prosecco with a twist of lime for an instant summer cocktail.

Bring the pumpkin puree to a simmer over medium heat in a 2-quart saucepan. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 to 3 minutes or until slightly thickened. Remove from the heat and add the ginger, nutmeg and dark brown sugar. Set aside to cool to room temperature (approximately 1 hour).
Heat the oven to 300 degrees F.

Cut a parchment paper circle and long strip to fit the bottom and sides of a 9 by 3-inch cake pan. Brush the bottom and sides of the pan with melted butter. Adhere the parchment pieces to the bottom and sides of the pan.
Prepare the crust by placing the ginger cookies, 1 tablespoon of dark brown sugar and salt into the bowl of a food processor and process into a fine crumb, approximately 1 to 2 minutes.
With the food processor running, drizzle in the melted butter. Stop and pulse 3 to 4 times or until the butter is well-incorporated.
Press the crust mixture into the bottom of the parchment-lined pan using a weighted glass. Bake for 15 minutes. Then cool for at least 10 minutes on a cooling rack.
Combine the eggs and vanilla in a small mixing bowl. Bring two quarts of water to a boil in an electric kettle.
Beat the cream cheese in a stand mixer with the paddle attachment for 10 seconds on low speed.

Add the prepared pumpkin mixture and mix on low for 30 seconds. Stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl. Turn the mixer up to medium, and beat until the mixture is lump free, approximately 1 to 2 minutes.

With the mixer still on medium speed, slowly pour in half of the egg mixture. Stop and scrape down the sides of the bowl. Add the rest of the egg mixture and mix until completely combined. Pour the filling into the cooled crust.
Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Heavily coat a tube bundt pan 1 tablespoon butter and 3 tablespoons sugar
Whisk together and set aside.

Cream the remaining butter and sugar together in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment on medium speed for 5 minutes. Add the eggs, one at a time, until fully incorporated. After all 4 eggs are in, add the vanilla extract and beat for 3 minutes until fluffy. Add the flour mixture to butter mixture and combine on low speed. Do not overbeat.
Combine the blueberries with the remaining 5 ounces (1 cup) all-purpose flour in ziptop bag and shake. Fold berry mixture into batter. Pour into prepared pan.

Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until probe thermometer comes out clean and registers 210 degrees F. Cool in the pan on a cooling rack for 15 minutes before depanning and cooling completely. Serve with strawberries and whipped cream.
Heat oven to 350 degrees F.

Spread oats into a thin layer on a half sheet pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly toasted and cool slightly %282-3 mins%29. Pulse the toasted oats in a food processor until the consistency of whole wheat flour.
Coat a 9 x 5-inch nonstick loaf pan with non-stick spray and set aside.
Add the flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt to the food processor and pulse 2 to 3 times to combine. Set aside.

Combine the butter and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer%2C and mix on medium speed using the paddle attachment for 2 to 3 minutes or until light in color. Stop and crape down the sides of the work bowl with as needed.

Reduce mixer speed to the lowest setting and add the eggs%2C one at a time%2C making sure each egg is fully incorporated before adding the next. Stop to scrape down the sides of the bowl%2C if necessary.

Add the vanilla extract and banana%2C and mix on medium-low to combine . Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes%2C remove from the pan%2C and cool completely before serving.
Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
Whisk together dry ingredients%3B then%2C drizzle in milk%2C whisking the whole time.

Combine in a medium bowl and mix with a spoon or your index finger until a rough dough forms. Turn it out onto a very lightly floured counter and knead for 10 minutes. Form it into a ball%2C place it on the counter and upend the mixing bowl over it. Set aside for 30 minutes.

Heat a 12-inch ovenproof skillet on the stove over high heat. Add butter and melt, tipping the pan around so it butters the sides too. Turn heat off and scrape batter into pan. Transfer skillet to oven and bake for 16 to 18 minutes, until pancake is billowy.
Remove from oven%2C garnish%2C and serve.
Bring a large pot of salty water to boil and heat your oven to 425 degrees F. Line a large baking sheet with foil and coat it lightly with butter or oil.

Place in a large bowl%2C and mash everything together with your hands until evenly mixed. Form mixture into 2-inch meatballs and arrange on prepared tray. Roast for 12 minutes%2C until cooked through %28you can cut one in half%29.
Once water is boiling, cook spaghetti until one minute shy of tender. Set aside 1 cup of cooking water before draining pasta.

In a deep saute pan or wide saucepan%2C combine ingredients and cook until garlic is golden%2C 30 seconds to 1 minute. Add tomatoes and season with remaining 1 teaspoon salt. Let mixture simmer for about 5 minutes%2C stirring occasionally.
When meatballs come out of the oven%2C add them to the sauce and stir so they are coated. Reduce heat to a low simmer%2C put a lid on the pot%2C and simmer meatballs in the sauce for 10 minutes.

Finish the sauce%3A Return spaghetti to its empty cooking pot. Push meatballs aside and grab a few ladles of their cooking sauce and pour over spaghetti. Add half of reserved pasta water and cook spaghetti and sauce over high heat for one minute%2C tossing the whole time. Use additional pasta water as needed to loosen. Use tongs to transfer spaghetti into a large%2C wide serving bowl. Add the meatballs and their sauce on top. Garnish with parsley and additional grated cheese. Serve immediately.
A day ahead%2C combine the raisins and the rum in a small bowl and cover%3B set aside for 24 hours.

Pour 1/3 of the sauce on the bottom of an 8 by 11 by 2-inch baking dish. Place the drained cauliflower on top and then spread the rest of the sauce evenly on top. Combine the bread crumbs with the Gruyere and sprinkle on top. Melt the butter and drizzle over the gratin. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes%2C until the top is browned. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Peel the apples%2C halve%2C core and slice thin in one direction%2C then halve the slices crosswise%2C creating thin rectangles. Place them in a large bowl and toss with lemon juice%2C sugar and cinnamon%2C if using. Add the raisins and any rum left in the bowl.

In a small skillet over medium-low heat%2C melt 3 tablespoons butter and add the breadcrumbs%2C sugar and salt. Stir to coat and cook%2C stirring frequently as they can burn quickly%2C until crumbs are an even golden brown and very fragrant. Set aside.
Heat your oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line 1 large or 2 smaller baking sheets with parchment paper.
Melt in a small dish.

Cover your work surface with a large towel. Sprinkle the cloth lightly with flour. Place the dough in the middle%2C sprinkle it very lightly with flour and roll in both directions until it%26%238217%3Bs about 10-by-13 inches%2C or about as far as the rolling pin can take it. Make sure the dough hasn%26%238217%3Bt stuck to the cloth%3B reflour if it has. Ball your hands to loose fists%2C put them under the rolled-out dough and gently start stretching the dough using the back of your hands. Alternate with pulling the dough gently with your fingers to continue stretching it%2C stretching the edges thin too. If holes form%2C pinch the dough back together. Continue stretching until the dough is about 16-by-24 inches.

Brush evenly with about half the melted butter. On the right side of the rectangle%2C a few inches from the end%2C spread the breadcrumbs top to bottom in a thick line%2C leaving a little more than an inch margin at the top and bottom of the strip. Scoop the apples with a slotted spoon%2C leaving any accumulated juices in the bowl%2C and pile them over the crumbs. Gently pull the top and bottom edges of the dough over the apple mixture. Pull the right edge of the dough up and over the filling as far as it will go without tearing. Working carefully%2C use the towel to roll up the strudel all the way. Place the parchment paper from your baking sheet at the edge of the roll and roll the strudel onto it. Ideally%2C it should be breadcrumb side-down on the parchment%2C you can roll it again if it%26%238217%3Bs not. Use the parchment like a sling to gently place the strudel on the baking sheet.

Brush the strudel generously all over with some of the remaining butter. Bake for 15 minutes%2C then brush again and return to the oven in a rotated position. Repeat this once%2C baking a total of 45 minutes %28half-size strudels bake 5 or so minutes faster%29. The finished strudel should be crisp to the touch and a deep golden brown.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let cool on a rack for at least 20 minutes before serving. Garnish and serve.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Cook the cauliflower florets in a large pot of boiling salted water for 5 to 6 minutes, until tender but still firm. Drain.

Meanwhile, melt 2 tablespoons of the butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add the flour, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon for 2 minutes. Pour the hot milk into the butter-flour mixture and stir until it comes to a boil. Boil, whisking constantly, for 1 minute, or until thickened. Off the heat, add 1 teaspoon of salt, the pepper, nutmeg, 1/2 cup of the Gruyere, and the Parmesan.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Break cauliflower into medium florets. Place floret in a pot with a teaspoon of salt%2C cover them with water and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes%2C until quite soft. Strain and let drip in the colander for a few minutes so they dry and cool.
Dry out pot%2C then heat the olive oil over high heat until almost smoking. Add drained spaghetti and 1 cup of reserved pasta water%2C taking care not to be burned by splattering liquid.

Halve the onion and cut a few thin rings off the end of one side%3B set them aside. Coarsely chop the remainder of the onion. Heat all of the olive oil in a saucepan and saute the chopped red onion and rosemary together until soft%2C about 8 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool.

Whisk eggs%2C olive oil%2C and onion mixture together. Stir in basil. Whisk flour%2C baking powder%2C turmeric%2C cheese%2C 1 1/2 teaspoons salt%2C and black pepper together in a separate bowl and add to egg mixture%2C whisking to remove lumps. Stir in cauliflower gently%2C so most pieces remain intact.

Line the bottom of a 9-inch %2824cm%29 round springform pan with parchment paper. Butter the sides generously. Put the sesame seeds in the pan and toss them around so that they stick to the sides. Pour in the cauliflower batter%2C arrange the reserved onion rings on top and bake cake in the center of the oven for 45 minutes%2C until golden brown and set. Serve warm or at room temperature.
Cook spaghetti in well-salted water in a large%2C wide-bottomed pot. Drain spaghetti%2C reserving 1 1/2 cups of pasta cooking water.
Add and toss together with tongs. Taste%2C adjusting fat%2C salt%2C and cheese as necessary.
Whisk dry ingredients in a large bowl. Cut butter into small cubes and add them to the flour mixture. Toss them to coat and use your fingers to squash each butter cube into flat pieces.
Serve immediately, sprinkling with reserved cheese and an extra grind or two of black pepper.

Pour water over butter-flour mixture and use a flexible silicone spatula or scraper to bring it together into a dough that will seem wet and sticky. Divide dough into two parts%2C and wrap each half into flat-ish packets wrapped in plastic%2C waxed or parchment paper. Chill in the fridge until firm%3B one to two hours.

Unwrap first packet of dough%2C place on a well-floured counter%2C sprinkle the top generously with flour%2C and roll it out into a thick-ish long rectangle. Brush off excess flour off dough with your hands and fold it as you would a business letter%2C into thirds. Continue to roll this packet into the shape needed for your final pie. Continue with your pie recipe as instructed.

Halve one pound of the tomatoes%2C then rub the cut sides against the large holes of a box grater set in a large bowl%2C discarding the skin. Core and chop the last two pounds of tomatoes and add to the grated tomato bowl. Add garlic%2C vinegar%2C salt%2C sugar%2C and pepper and let marinate at room temperature until ready to use%2C at least 10 minutes or up to 2 hours. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired.
Cook pasta in salted boiling water as package time recommends. Drain and toss with fresh sauce and basil. Serve at room temperature with a drizzle of olive oil and freshly grated cheese on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper. Butter the paper and the sides of the pan. Peel%2C halve and core your apples%2C then chop them into medium-sized chunks. Pile the cut apples directly in the prepared pan. Meanwhile%2C in a large bowl%2C using an electric mixer or whisk%2C beat eggs with sugar until thick and ribbons form on the surface of the beaten eggs. Beat in vanilla%2C then stir in flour with a spoon until just combined into a thick batter.

Pour the batter over the apples in the pan%2C using a spoon or spatula to spread the batter so that it covers all exposed apples. Bake in preheated oven for 55 to 60 minutes%2C or until a tester comes out free of batter. Cool in pan for 10 minutes on rack%2C then flip out onto another rack%2C peel off the parchment paper%2C and flip it back onto a serving platter.
Line a large baking sheet with foil and set an oven-safe cooling rack on top.
Position two racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and lower temperature to 325 degrees F. Line two large baking sheets with parchment paper.
Dust with cinnamon and powdered sugar and serve.
Pat wings dry with a paper towel%2C and then%2C in a large bowl%2C toss them with baking powder and  kosher salt.

Heat oven to 450 degrees%2C with a rack set in the top half. Bake wings for 20 minutes%2C flip them with tongs or a spatula%2C bake them for another 15 minutes%2C flip them back over again%2C and then for 15 final minutes%2C for a total roasting time of 50 minutes. You might need up to 5 minutes longer for larger wings. Wings are done with they are browned and crisp.

While the wings roast%2C make Buffalo wing sauce. In a medium saucepan%2C combine hot sauce and butter over medium heat until melted%2C whisking to combine. Set aside. When wings are done%2C roll each in prepared Buffalo wing sauce. Serve with fixings of your choice. Eat immediately with carrots and celery.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Spread the walnut halves on a large rimmed baking sheet and toast in the oven for about 9 minutes%2C until they are golden and fragrant. Let cool slightly%2C then transfer the walnut halves to a work surface and coarsely chop them.

In a large bowl%2C whisk the confectioners sugar with the cocoa powder and salt followed by the chopped walnuts. While whisking%2C add the egg whites and vanilla extract and beat just until the batter is moistened.
Divide dough into 3 pieces and roll out 1 piece (keep remaining pieces covered with plastic wrap) on a sheet of parchment paper into a 10-inch round (shape can be rustic; dough should be thin).
Spoon the batter onto the baking sheets in evenly spaced mounds. Rest for 30-60 minutes on the pan.
Preheat oven to 450°F with a heavy baking sheet on rack in middle.

Stir together flour, chopped rosemary, baking powder, and salt in a medium bowl. Make a well in center, then add water and oil and gradually stir into flour with a wooden spoon until a dough forms. Knead dough gently on a work surface 4 or 5 times.

Bake for 14 to 16 minutes%2C until the tops are glossy and lightly cracked%3B shift the pans from front to back and top to bottom halfway through to ensure even baking. Slide the parchment paper %28with the cookies%29 onto 2 wire racks. Let cookies cool completely%2C and store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

Lightly brush top with additional oil and scatter small clusters of rosemary leaves on top%2C pressing in slightly. Sprinkle with sea salt. Slide round %28still on parchment%29 onto preheated baking sheet and bake until pale golden and browned in spots%2C 8 to 10 minutes. Transfer flatbread %28discard parchment%29 to a rack to cool%2C then make 2 more rounds %281 at a time%29 on fresh parchment %28do not oil or salt until just before baking%29. Break into pieces.
Flatbread can be made 2 days ahead and cooled completely, then kept in an airtight container at room temperature.
Heat oven to 425 degrees F with one 12-inch round ovenproof skillet%2C two 9-inch round ovenproof skillets%2C and the equivalent sized baking dishes inside.
In a large bowl%2C beat eggs thoroughly with a whisk or fork. Add salt and flour%2C whisk until lumps disappear. Add milk and black pepper%2C whisking until smooth.

When oven and baking vessel are fully heated%2C wearing potholders%2C carefully remove skillet%28s%29 or baking dish%28es%29 from the oven. Melt butter inside and roll it around so it goes up the sides%2C too.

Pour batter into buttered dish%28es%29 and return it to the oven. Bake for 12 to 13 minutes to start%2C and then in additional 1 to 2 minute increments until the edges are deeply golden brown and the centers are just beginning to color. Transfer to a cooling rack. Finish with grated cheese and fresh herbs. Eat immediately.

Heat oven to 325 degrees F. Line an 8%26%23215%3B8-inch baking pan with parchment paper. In a medium-sized pot%2C melt butter with brown sugar%2C golden syrup%2C and salt together over medium-high heat. Once bubbles form%2C simmer for one minute%2C then stir in oats off the heat. Spread in pan in an even layer and baked bars for 20 to 25 minutes%2C until deeply golden at edges.

Let them rest in their pan on a cooling rack for 3 to 4 minutes before sprinkling the chips all over%2C then waiting 5 minutes before spreading them in a single layer. Cool at room temperature or in the fridge. Serve.

Clean and wash the lemons. Cut off the top quarter of the lemons and slice a thin bevel off the bottom%2C so they can stand up straight. Using a paring knife%2C carefully remove all of the lemon flesh and juice%2C being careful not to cut through the bottom. Stand the lemons on a plate or cookie sheet and freeze until solid.

Line your cutting board with plastic wrap. Smash plantains under a plastic wrap-lined metal can or heavy skillet to roughly 1%2F8th to 1%2F4-inch thickness. Alternatively%2C use a tortilla or patac%C3%B3n press.

Heat oil up to 350%C2%B0F to 375%C2%B0F and return plantains to pot. Cook%2C stirring and flipping occasionally until golden brown and crisp. Transfer to a paper towel-line plate and immediately season with salt. Serve plantains with guacamole immediately.

Place melted butter in the bottom of a large bowl. Stir in rosemary%2C salt%2C and pepper. Add potato slices and mix to evenly coat them. Spread potato slices and remaining ingredients at the bottom of the bowl in a metal sheet pan - don%27t use glass for this recipe as the temperatures are too high.

Using a food processor or a blender%2C toss fresh mint leaves into the work bowl. Add the scooped out lemon flesh and juice%2C and pulse until mostly pureed. Let mixture stand for 15 minutes%2C so the mint releases its flavor%2C then press the mixture through a fine-mesh strainer. You%26%238217%3Bll end up with approximately one cup of lemon-mint juice.

Stir in the water%2C then sugar%2C one tablespoon at a time until the sugar is dissolved and the mixture is to your desired level of sweetness. Pour the mixture into a large roasting pan or baking dish%2C large enough that the liquid isn%26%238217%3Bt more than one-inch deep.
Whisk together in a bowl and use as needed.

Freeze for one hour%2C then remove the mixture and scrape with two forks to break up the ice. Return to the freezer and freeze until solid%2C about 2 to 3 hours%2C scraping it again with forks every hour or so.
When the granita is frozen%2C rake until glittery. Scoop into frozen lemon shells and serve.
Heat oven to 500 degrees F.

Roast potatoes for 15 minutes. Use a thin metal spatula to loosen potatoes and turn them over. Roast for a second 15 minutes%2C then carefully pour stock or broth into pan and add the garlic cloves. Roast for 15 minutes more%2C until potatoes are fully tender. Remove from oven. Transfer to a serving platter along with any remaining liquid in pan and serve warm.

Heat oil in a wok or Dutch oven until it registers 300%C2%B0F on an instant read or deep-fry thermometer. Add plantains and cook%2C stirring occasionally%2C until cooked through%2C about 5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate.
Adjust oven rack to middle position%2C preheat to 350%C2%B0F%2C and line 2 aluminum half sheet pans with parchment %28not wax paper%29.
Combine butter%2C vanilla%2C egg%2C brown sugar%2C white sugar%2C kosher salt%2C cinnamon%2C and baking soda in a medium bowl. Stir until no lumps remain. F
Fold in rolled oats%2C followed by the flour and dried cherries %28you can also use raisins or cranberries%29.
Divide into 30 one-ounce portions with a roughly 2-tablespoon scoop and arrange on prepared sheet pans. Let stand at room temperature for at least 25 minutes%2C no more than

Bake until pale gold around the edges%2C but still puffed and steamy in the center%2C about 15 minutes. Cool directly on sheet pans until firm%2C about 10 minutes. Enjoy warm%2C or store in airtight container up to 3 days at room temperature.

In a large dutch oven or pot%2C heat 3 tablespoons of reserved strained oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add in chile pur%C3%A9e and cook%2C stirring constantly%2C until mixture has thickened to consistency of tomato paste%2C about 10 minutes. Stir in spice mixture%2C bring to a boil%2C then reduce heat to low and simmer%2C stirring frequently%2C for 30 minutes. Stir in 4 cups chicken stock and chocolate. Simmer%2C partially covered%2C for 1 hour%2C stirring occasionally.
Stir in sugar and season mole with salt and additional sugar to taste. Remove from heat%2C use immediately or transfer to airtight container and store in refrigerator for up to a month.
In a teapot or saucepan%2C bring the water to a simmer. Pour the hot water into a mug.

Add the whiskey%2C 2 teaspoons honey and 2 teaspoon lemon juice. Stir until the honey has disappeared into the hot water. Taste%2C and add 1 teaspoon honey for more sweetness%2C and%2For 1 teaspoon more lemon juice for more zing.
Garnish with a lemon round and cinnamon stick %28if using%29. Enjoy%21

Working in two batches%2C pur%C3%A9e spice mixture in blender until as smooth as possible. Set a fine mesh strainer over a large bowl and strain spice mixture%2C using a rubber spatula to push through as much spice mixture as possible. Discard solids and set spice mixture aside.

Return skillet to medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering%2C add in tomatillos and tomatoes. Cook until softened%2C about 10 minutes%2C stirring occasionally. Transfer tomatillos and tomato to bowl with spice mixture. Add 2 1%2F2 cups of chicken stock to bowl with spice mixture.

Fry bread until golden brown%2C 1 to 2 minutes per side%3B transfer to paper towel lined plate. Fry tortillas until golden brown%2C about 1 minute per side%3B transfer to paper towel lined plate. Remove skillet from heat. Break bread and tortillas into small pieces and transfer to bowl with spice mixture.

Set fine mesh strainer over small bowl and strain oil from skillet. Place 2 tablespoons of strained oil to now empty skillet. Heat over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add in onions and cook until browned%2C about 10 minutes%2C stirring occasionally.
Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant%2C about 1 minute. Transfer onions and garlic to bowl with spice mixture%2C leaving as much oil in pan as possible.

Return skillet with oil to 350%C2%B0F over medium-high heat. One at a time%2C fry almonds%2C peanuts%2C pumpkin seeds%2C and raisins until toasted%2C about 1 minute for almonds%2C 45 seconds for peanuts%2C 20 seconds for pumpkin seeds%2C and 15 seconds for raisins. Transfer each batch to a paper towel lined plate as it is done. Transfer almonds%2C peanuts%2C pumpkin seeds%2C and raisins to bowl with spice mixture.

Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat to 350%C2%B0F. Working in batches%2C fry chilies until slightly darkened%2C about 20 seconds per batch%3B transfer chilies to paper towel lined plate as each batch is finished. Remove skillet from heat and reserve. Transfer chilies to a large bowl and add boiling water to cover. Let steep for 30 minutes. Strain chiles%2C reserving soaking liquid.

Working in 3 batches%2C place 1%2F3 of the chilies%2C 1%2F3 cup soaking liquid%2C and 1%2F4 cup chicken stock into blender and pur%C3%A9e until as smooth as possible. Set a fine mesh strainer over a large bowl and strain chile mixture%2C using a rubber spatula to push through as much chile mixture as possible. Discard solids and set chile pur%C3%A9e aside.
